boardgame.name: Das Umsteigespiel
boardgame.description:
There are 2 variants of the game, one with cards to be placed face up, the other with cards to be placed face down. The aim is to be the first to get rid of his cards. The last card to be discarded must be matched (number +1 / -1 or color with exact number). Some special cards offer additional discard options. In the face-down version, cheating is allowed, but you must not get caught.

—user summary

boardgame.name: The Dilemmas Game
boardgame.description:
The Dilemmas Game invites you to flex your moral muscles and compare your problem-solving skills with those of your friends and family. Players must propose different solutions to 52 common dilemmas, using analogies or drawing on real-life experiences to explain their answers.

On their turn, a player (The Questioner) will draw one of the dilemma's and present it to the group. The other players will give their advice in turn. Once all perspectives have been given, The Questioner chooses the best advice and awards that player the Dilemma Card. The player who collects the most dilemma cards is crowned the winner.

boardgame.name: Armor of the Banana Knight
boardgame.description:
From the description:

The Banana Knight Armor set is a low-level magic set that is sure to make your players feel rewarded for their efforts!

boardgame.name: Down the Abandoned Well
boardgame.description:
From the description:

There is a long-forgotten well, only known by the plants and stone. It is hand-dug, and deep, and dark. There are echoes of shapes moving through it. The cool damp. Stillness. No one really talks about the well. It sits, alone, but now, you are here, and now you have to reckon with it.
This ritual does not play nice. This ritual demands you address past woes that affect you today. You cannot leave until someone chooses to Go Down the Well.

This is a ritual to be used in your Sleepaway game.

boardgame.name: Bat Cultist Lair
boardgame.description:
From the description:

A dark and scary cave holds a magical artifact, but a group of mad mice cultists stand between you and the divine "white oak vessel". Parlay with the bats, defeat the cultists, perhaps harvest the guano, just don't stick around too long...

boardgame.name: Venom
boardgame.description:
From the description:

The scene is a familiar one...

Bedraggled adventurers gather around the great oaken table at the Drake’s Tongue Tavern, recounting their tales of fortune and glory. This band of dungeoneers has recently returned from a particularly successful delve and plunder—they’ve exhumed an ancient artifact of untold power. Each one eyes the others uneasily as they spin their stories of daring and danger, deftly avoiding the sensitive topic of exactly which of them will claim the relic for themselves.

Though their purses overflow with gold and jewels, their eyes gleam with avarice for the ultimate prize—and one of their number has taken matters into their own hands, slipping a deadly poison into their companions’ tankards.

At the end of the evening, after the last tale is told, only one treasure-seeker will draw breath, sliding past the slumped forms of their erstwhile companions with the ultimate reward in hand.

boardgame.name: Fire Game
boardgame.description:
The players get two fire engines and put their figure on the success ladder. The first to put out six fires wins the game. The fire locations are marked on the game board in order. The players roll the dice and move their fire engines towards the fire scene. The first player to reach the exact location of the fire has extinguished the fire and may advance one space on the success ladder. On yellow playing fields, an action card can be drawn to trigger an advantage for one's own fire department or a disadvantage for another fire department.

—user summary

boardgame.name: HARDCODED
boardgame.description:
Hardcoded is a simultaneous action-selection fighting game, where players secretly program their characters to perform special moves in an attempt to outmaneuver and ultimately knock out their opponents. The game can be played free-for-all (2, 3, or 4 players), in teams of 2 (4 players), or against an AI opponent.

The game is played in rounds. Each round consists of several parts:
1. roll for speed (simultaneous, secret);
2. select actions (simultaneous, secret);
3. reveal actions;
4. player turns (each player in speed order move on the board and attack if possible);
5. pass priority tracker and start the next round.

Each character starts with 5 HP. When a character is dealt damage, their HP is reduced by that amount. A character reduced to 0 HP is Knocked Out (KO’d). A KO’d character respawns at the end of the current round. The player that KO’d them receives 1 point, and the first player (or team) to reach 2 points wins.

boardgame.name: Oh My Ring!
boardgame.description:
In Oh My Ring!, you need to be quick and agile to slide your rings from one finger to the next while trying to match the combinations on the cards.

Each player starts with eight colored rings: two of each color, with four on each hand. Each turn, a card is revealed that shows one or two hands and a combination of colored rings. As quickly as you can, move the rings from finger to finger to recreate that pattern before anyone else. The fastest player to do so wins the card, and whoever first collects five cards wins.

Some constraints will make the task harder, such as treating one color as another or forcing you to switch rings without looking at your fingers.

listing.notes:
Spieleranzahl: 2 bis 4 Spieldauer: 15 Minuten Altersempfehlung: 10+
OH MY RING - Master of the Rings Geschicklichkeit, Schnelligkeit, Konzentration… und gute Laune, ob mit Familie oder Freunden: Das sind die Zutaten von Oh my ring!, unserem neuen Spiel in der Holzkollektion. Setze die farbigen Ringe auf deine Finger, drehe eine Karte um und kopiere die darauf abgebildete Kombination mit deinen Händen - und zwar vor den anderen! Beachte jedoch die Einschränkungen, die dir die Aufgabe erschweren: Schaffst du es mit unter dem Tisch versteckten Händen, verschobenen Ringen, oder sogar, wenn du dir die Karte nur wenige Sekunden ansehen darfst?
Die Ringe bestehen aus Holz … aber nicht nur! Sie sind aus einem organischen Bestandteil hergestellt, der rund 60 % recyceltes Holz enthält: Das schont unsere Umwelt!
Sei schnell und geschickt, um deine Ringe von Finger zu Finger zu schieben und die auf den Karten dargestellten Kombinationen vor deinen Gegnern fertigzukriegen. Achte auf die verschiedenen Einschränkungen: Schaffst du es, wenn die Farben spiegelverkehrt sein müssen, oder ohne auf deine Finger zu schauen? Ein Partyspiel, das Geschicklichkeit und Geschwindigkeit vereint!
Inhalt: 32 Ringe in 4 verschiedenen Farben 55 Karten 1 Spielregeln
• Ringe aus recyceltem Material • Ein originelles Geschicklichkeitsspiel • Ein Partyspiel, das für Spass sorgt • Lachen garantiert!
Mit Spielregeln in folgenden Sprachen:DE, EN, FR, ES, IT, NL
Title: Oh My Ring! Publisher: Helvetiq Language(s): English German French

boardgame.name: Chippo-Chippo
boardgame.description:
The players should place their pieces as quickly as possible on a 6x6 square. The player whose turn it is rolls a number die and a letter die and places his own piece on the diced square or removes another piece, if there is one. If there is already one of your own pieces on the diced field, nothing happens.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Deck the Halls
boardgame.description:
It’s December 23rd at 4 PM and the house is not yet decorated for Christmas! Work together (Collaborate) to get the house “decked” in time. Christmas is fast approaching. Get the 10 locations inside and outside of your house “decked,” and the house cleaned up by the time the clock strikes Midnight on December 25th. Play as a team against the game. You all win or you all lose. Choose your actions carefully because time passes quickly and supplies are limited. There are many distractions keeping the task from getting done. But keep your chin up, Christmas is a time to celebrate and there’s plenty of Christmas cheer to keep you motivated. The magic of Christmas is in your hands!

To start players will select one of six characters and place the Clock Token on Dec 23rd slot. On his/her turn, each player will roll five dice, collect the associated ornament pieces, and cheer/distraction cards. They'll then perform up to 4 actions. You may repeat the same action multiple times or choose a combination of different actions. At the end of their turn, players will advance the Clock Token one space.

If you and your friends can get all 10 locations inside and outside the house "decked" before the Clock Token strikes midnight you win the game.

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Unmemory
boardgame.description:
unmemory lives at the intersection of literature and game, taking advantage of the best of both worlds. You need to read to overcome challenging puzzles and move forward in a thriller story where image, sound and interactive functions are carefully interwoven into the narrative.

The result is an experience that tests your ability to solve a mystery, but above all that makes you feel inside the story.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Get on Board. Маршрути: Нью-Йорк / Лондон
Get on Board: New York & London
請上車: 紐約 & 倫敦
boardgame.description:
Ah, here’s the bus! Hurry, grab a seat, and get out of the rain! Just like every trip, you're fascinated by all the other passengers on board: tourists, professionals, students... They're all traveling together, though they each have different destinations. This bus line is truly special, but will it be able to transport everyone safe and sound?

In Get on Board: New York & London, you have twelve rounds in which to build the best bus line in town. Each round reveals a new card that shows each player the route shape they must complete. Place your bus accordingly on the central board. Take the passengers where they want to go by connecting them and their destination to your bus line, avoid traffic, and gain as many victory points as possible!

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2022 UK Games Expo Best Boardgame (Strategic Style) Nominee
2022 UK Games Expo Best Boardgame (Strategic Style) People's Choice Award Winner

boardgame.name: Legacy of Dust
boardgame.description:
From publisher:

Legacy of Dust is a small postcard sized addition for The Singing Sands which allows the player to quickly create a character who has influenced the desert. This character may be long dead or still around at the moment, The people you encounter during a game of the Singing Sands may remember them fondly, sing of their deeds or curse their names. In some cases history may have wiped away their names or stories, but the scars of their existence will still live on in the land.

To use Legacy of Dust simply roll a d12 for each table and use these prompts to build the characters history. Or make note of the prompts and uncover more of this character as you play The Singing Sands.

boardgame.name: Poles of Power
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

It’s the turn of the 11th century BCE in the Mediterranean. The kingdoms of the Achaean Greeks, the empire of the Hittites, the trade centre of Troy, and the powerful city-states that line the coast have fallen. Egypt faces ruin. The world, as you know it, is ending.

Welcome to the Late Bronze Age Collapse.

Blown off course on a trade mission, you find yourselves in the Levantine port city of Anatheros, with both a tyrant that seeks to exploit you and an opposition faction of aristocrats who would likely be happy to do the same. All you want to do is repair your vessel and sail home, but it seems that everyone with power conspires to stop you from doing so. How far can they push you? What will Anatheros look like when you finally do sail away?

In Poles of Power, you play a character who has fled their homeland during this time of disasters and chaos, and has found a community among those we now know as the Sea Peoples. Kingdoms, cities, and order itself have all collapsed, and now you seek to protect the community you have found—family and friends both.

boardgame.name: The Secret of Strangelight Hall
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Weird magic and wondrous tricks await in this adventure for the world’s greatest roleplaying game!

Strangelight Hall is an ancient mansion that stands on the edge of a lonely and dangerous moor. The owner has recently gone missing and the mansion is now filled with weird magic, unsettling haunts, and bizarre creatures. But there are greater powers at work and a deeper mystery at hand. It will require all of your courage and wit to unravel the secret of Strangelight Hall...

The Secret of Strangelight Hall is a 4- to 8-hour adventure for 1st- through 4th-level characters. It has been thoroughly playtested, requires minimal preparation to run, and can be easily used with any Fifth Edition campaign!

boardgame.name: Arturo: un compleanno da paura
boardgame.description:
Arturo - A Spooktacular Birthday Party' is a game in which you have to help little Arturo's eccentric family plan their birthday party. Each player has a secret family plan where they declare which family members will do a better job.

In each round the player must choose a familiar card to collect the items needed for the party, focusing on getting the ones that best suit their game objectives.

Getting the characters who contributed the most to the party to the top of your family plan is an integral part of the strategy. When the piles of cards in the center of the table are exhausted, the player who has trusted the best family members will win the game.

boardgame.name: Savage Land of Ug!
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The players take on the roles of a neophyte hunting party in a prehistoric world filled with dinosaurs and various threats — the greatest of which may be their limited vocabularies.

boardgame.name: The Mole on Pirad One
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

During a repair job to the remote freespace station PIRAD ONE, you meet a unique group of social and political outcasts and quickly learn that some have more powerful secrets than others. There is a force working from the shadows - one commune member is here on behalf of DEXTRO-SINGLETON, a powerful corp willing to do whatever it takes to secure the station and a valuable asset hidden within it. When things go bad, will you aid the disenfranchised that call PIRAD ONE home?

THE MOLE ON PIRAD ONE is a pamphlet adventure for use with the MOTHERSHIP sci-fi horror RPG.

Easily played as a one-to-two session standalone adventure or slotted into an existing campaign, THE MOLE ON PIRAD ONE sees players trapped aboard a damaged station and pitted against an undercover corporate agent with a very pressing deadline.

boardgame.name: Sagrada: Promo 8 – Apollo/Godfather Window Pattern Card
Sagrada: Promo 8 – Carte Motif De Vitrail Apollo
boardgame.description:
Play this card to complete your goal.
Ref : Sagrada-PROM-8 Apollo and Godfather.

boardgame.name: 7 Wonders Duel: Gold, silver and bronze Conflict pawns
boardgame.description:
Metal Conflict pawn delivered as tournament prizes.

These are markers used for measuring Conflict. It replaces the plastic one that comes with the game.

boardgame.name: The Haunt Trilogy
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

[A] deluxe special edition collection of the best-selling horror-themed adventure series.

User summary:

This item gathers together and revises material previously published in:


The Haunt
The Haunt 2
The Haunt 3

boardgame.name: Plague of Frogs
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

he Plague of Frogs is an adventure/mystery for Liminal Horror that has the players investigate a rash of attacks that have end up being more than random bouts of violence. Can they stop the Plague of Frogs without fracturing their minds & bodies?

boardgame.name: Burying the Past
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

DDAl10-10 Burying the Past

A Plague of Ancients Adventure

The bombs are constructed, the plans laid. The only thing remaining is the easy part: stealing into an ancient, alien city full of nightmarish creatures from beyond the limits of sanity, setting the bombs, and escaping the city without getting caught before they detonate. Simple!

Part Ten of the Plague of Ancients Series of Adventures.

A Four-Hour Adventure for 10th through 13th-Level Characters
Optimized for APL 11

boardgame.name: A Song of Spears
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Kaskur Spearsong and those loyal to him, in an attempt to show Old Goat what actual leadership looks like, entered Xorvintroth to rescue the missing clan members and bit off more than they could chew. However, they found something other than their kin in the ruins of the ancient Abeiran city—and unwittingly brought it back with them. Will their foolish endeavors spell the end of the Thuunlakalaga clan?

A Three-Hour Epic for 5th- through 13th-Level Characters.
Optimized for APL 8 and APL 11.

Single Table Play
Guidance is included in this Epic for a single DM to run the adventure for a single table.

Epics in Online Play
One of the attractions of Epic play is the feeling of camaraderie instilled by playing in a large area filled with excited players, as well as the face-to-face interaction between groups and NPCs in that setting. The pandemic we currently face makes such gatherings problematic. Much D&D play has moved online, and that medium offers both challenges and opportunities.

Throughout this adventure, we provide sidebars to discuss and offer suggestions for porting the Epic experience to an online venue.

boardgame.name: Rise: Mafia Empire
boardgame.description:
RISE: Mafia Empire is a game where you take up the role as a Don in a prohibition era crime family. You will build rackets, defend territory, defeat your rivals, and build an empire!

The goal of the game is to either dismantle and destroy all of the rival families, or make so much money no one else can have any.

Each turn consists of 3 actions. You can spend actions by buying/building rackets (the illegal backbone of your crime empire) and or buying/building fronts to disguise the rackets. Or you can hire family members to defend these businesses or attack other families.

The game ends when all other player's Dons have been killed. If the money deck runs out, whoever has the most money wins.

boardgame.name: Sriracha: The Game
boardgame.description:
Includes 52 cards with all original Sriracha and food themed illustrations.

Divvy up the cards evenly between players and get ready to slap the deck for pairs and sandwiches. Or play Sriracha Cards to stay alive! The first player to collect all the cards wins.

Pair Them Up
If the card played is a match to the top card, this is a pair. First one to slap the pile gets all the cards. Add these new cards to the bottom of your deck.

Mmmmm...sandwiches
If the card played is a match to the card underneath the top card, this is a sandwich. First one to slap the pile gets all the cards.

Add Some Heat
Play Sriracha Cards to get more cards and stay alive!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Thieves
boardgame.description:
Thieves is a fast paced game of stealing and backstabbing set in Victorian London!

In this game you will use your knife to mug other players for all of their gold, but be careful, they might have a gun. Or you could try and steal money from their secret safe using your lock pick. But again, be careful, there might be a body guard around.

The game is about attacks, and counter attacks... and sometimes counter attacks to the counter attack.

In the end the richest person will win the day!

boardgame.name: Shadows in the Stacks
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Dreams of the Red Wizards: Terminal Ambitions Adventure

DDAL-DRW-11 Shadows in the Stacks

Hoping to put names to the location descriptions you uncovered in Waterdeep, you head to Candlekeep. You are not alone. Some want what you know, others don’t want you to learn more.

A Four-Hour Adventure for 5th through 10th-Level Characters.
Optimized for: APL 8

CONTENT WARNINGS: illness (fictional, contagious, quarantine), madness, suicide (mention of thoughts).q
boardgame.rpgseries: DDAL - Dreams of the Red Wizards

boardgame.name: To Walk the Cold Dark
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

DDAL-DRW-12 To Walk the Cold Dark

In search of the Tenebrous Creed’s lair, you head to the Thunder Peaks—and the prison of an ancient evil bound there by the elves of Myth Drannor.

Part Four of the Shadow Games series of adventures

A four hour adventure for 5th through 10th level characters.

Optomized for: APL 8

CONTENT WARNINGS: death (murder by consuming flesh), “madness,” abduction, imprisonment, illness, loss of self.
boardgame.rpgseries: DDAL - Dreams of the Red Wizards

boardgame.name: Back to the Front
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Your quarry has been located, meaning that returning them to Alanik Ray is just a matter of getting to them.

Unfortunately, a never-ending horde of zombies stands between them and you—can you complete your mission?

The third in the Ravenloft: Mist Hunters series of adventures.

An adventure for 3rd-level characters.

CONTENT WARNING: Violent despotism, execution by impaling, traumas of war, involuntary servitude, child soldiers, children in peril, grotesque body modification, gore, violence

boardgame.name: Valroc
boardgame.description:
Welcome to Valroc, the famous city of wizards. You are one of them competing in a great tournament to acquire the Archmage title. With the help of your assistant, earn skill points in each of the 4 elements (Fire, Water, Earth and Air) and enter the arena to tame and chase the most dangerous creatures from the land. Will you take risks in fighting mythical creatures, use black magic or rely on your own knowledge to achieve this actions? Train yourself, attend magical lessons and make offerings to the gods… As many possible strategies as imaginable but only yours will lead you to victory!

In Valroc, you play wizards in competition to acquire the Archmage title. For that, you will have to defeat terrible creatures (or tame them). The first player who has defeated or tamed six creatures ends the game. The winner is the player with the most Prestige Points.

The game is split into two different phases :
• The first one is a draft phase in which the players must select the creatures they will have to fight. Thereby they will prepare their tournament as well as possible.
• The second phase is the tournament in which the players will fight against each other by a worker placement mechanic.

boardgame.name: The Big Book of Characters Volume 28
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Oftentimes we find ourselves sitting around the table, with a set adventure path before our players, and the inevitable happens. One player is unprepared for the session or is in need of a new character.

No problem.

Within this collection are 100 different characters. Each Character has an origin, a reason for leaving, family members and their disposition towards the character. Non-human Characters also have a middle name in common for non native speakers. Each character comes with character points to spend on abilities and the players can decide which profession they want to follow in the Morgalad Core RPG Book, and they have money to buy equipment.

Whether providing a new character after an unfortunate death or providing a new character for a new player this book provides random characters from level 1-5.
boardgame.rpgitemversion: El gran libro de los personajes

boardgame.name: The Big Book of Characters Volume 29
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Oftentimes we find ourselves sitting around the table, with a set adventure path before our players, and the inevitable happens. One player is unprepared for the session or is in need of a new character.

No problem.

Within this collection are 100 different characters. Each Character has an origin, a reason for leaving, family members and their disposition towards the character. Non-human Characters also have a middle name in common for non native speakers. Each character comes with character points to spend on abilities and the players can decide which profession they want to follow in the Morgalad Core RPG Book, and they have money to buy equipment.

Whether providing a new character after an unfortunate death or providing a new character for a new player this book provides random characters from level 1-5.
boardgame.rpgitemversion: El gran libro de los personajes

boardgame.name: The Big Book of Characters Volume 30
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Oftentimes we find ourselves sitting around the table, with a set adventure path before our players, and the inevitable happens. One player is unprepared for the session or is in need of a new character.

No problem.

Within this collection are 100 different characters. Each Character has an origin, a reason for leaving, family members and their disposition towards the character. Non-human Characters also have a middle name in common for non native speakers. Each character comes with character points to spend on abilities and the players can decide which profession they want to follow in the Morgalad Core RPG Book, and they have money to buy equipment.

Whether providing a new character after an unfortunate death or providing a new character for a new player this book provides random characters from level 1-5.
boardgame.rpgitemversion: El gran libro de los personajes

boardgame.name: Red Giant Quickstart Rules
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Red Giant is a Tabletop Role Playing Game influenced by, but not limited to, anime and manga such as Vampire Hunter D, Berserk, and Claymore. Red Giant aims to recreate the various themes, dynamics, and scenarios seen in these types of media.

Red Giant is very adaptable and can be used in a myriad of ways to suit your tabletop game, as the core of this system provides many tools for use in creating your own customized session.

No one knows how the Red Giant came to be: some people believe it was an act of god, some believe it was due to ancient technology, but no matter how this planet became cursed, it is clear that

YOU CANNOT SAVE THIS WORLD.

Stories passed down through the ages all describe in detail a day long ago where the sun suddenly grew and became consumed in a blood red color. As the people stared at the sky a crimson haze slowly crept across the surface of the planet. It’s been said that this was the beginning of what was known as “the end of the world” or “the rapture” by people of that time.

From this day forward humanity and the world that they knew was forever changed, horrific beings and aberrations began to rise, seemingly from the soil itself. Beings of absolute terror and structures the human mind cannot comprehend appeared from nothingness. It was not long before humanity was ultimately driven to the edge of extinction, facing these impossible threats.

People now eke out a small existence throughout the lands attempting to avoid or defeat the horrors and creatures that have awakened from the planet in order to survive, but for what and for what cost?

boardgame.name: Over Arms Quick Start Rules
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Over Arms is a rules-light Tabletop Role Playing Game designed for people familiar with series like JoJo’s Bizarre Adventure, Persona, Fate, Shaman King, etc. This game aims to recreate the themes, mechanics, and powers as seen in these kind of media.

Over Arms is very adaptable and can be used in a myriad of ways to suit your tabletop game, as the core of this system allows for you to create your own abilities while using two entities as one character.

Over Arms also comes with a bevy of information that will be more than helpful in aiding both the GM and the Players in understanding the inner workings of the Over Arms system throughout this book.

These quickstart rules will allow you to start your own Over Arms game and experience a portion of the action, adventure, and mystery contained in the full product.

boardgame.name: Neko Goblin Field Notes
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Ryuutama is an RPG developed in Japan by designer Atsuhiro Okada. It is set in a world where the "NPCs" of the village--the bakers, farmers, shopkeepers and healers--set off on a wonderful adventure exploring a fantasy world together. Some people colloquially call it "Hayao Miyazaki's Oregon Trail", because of its heartwarming (in Japanese "honobono") feel of family anime, and its focus on traveling and wonder over combat and treasure.

This supplement contains the following new additions to the Ryuutama RPG:


6 New Classes
3 New Types
New Physical and Magical Characteristics
New facilities
New Armor and weapons
"Guilds" mechanic
New school of magic

boardgame.name: Bancho Meow Meow
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Bancho Meow Meow is a competitive and rules-light tabletop RPG system where you will balance on the border between life as a normal street cat and life as the Bancho of your own cat gang. During the daytime Cat gang law prohibits fighting so you must live out your life as a simple street cat, jumping from building to building, engaging humans for food and affection, or scouting your enemies hideouts. At night the streets come alive with sword-wielding, ninja-like Cat gangs that engage in a tug of war over territories and power!

boardgame.name: Behind the Walls
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

"It could happen to you when you least expect it, maybe you're opening a door at work or simply taking a walk on a route you normally avoid. Suddenly you're in a place that feels familiar but is barren and strange. As you search for an exit or something truly familiar your anxiety begins to build and build, higher with every step. You begin to search for a sign of life by loudly saying "hello?". its then that you see it, that which rests Behind The Walls."

Behind The Walls is a TRPG that focuses on exploring liminal spaces and the concepts of what might lurk within them. Inspired by the popular Backrooms concept, Behind The Walls provides a set of rules and aids to help guide you through the unknown and hopefully back out again. Behind the Walls was designed as a simple horror game that can be played on rainy nights, blustery days, and anytime you're hanging out with friends.

boardgame.name: Gimmick Zero Quickstart Guide
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Gimmick Zero is a rules-light tabletop RPG focused on people who have become living weapons in order to take down colossal machines gone rogue in order to save what remains of their society.

Catered to both rookies and veterans of tabletop RPGS, Gimmick Zero presents a flexible system and framework to run sessions, campaigns, and one-shots in a variety of different settings with mechanics inspired by media such as Bubblegum Crisis, Katana Zero, Megaman Zero and more.

Gimmick Zero also comes with a bevy of information that will be more than helpful in aiding both the GM and the Players in understanding the inner workings of the game system.

boardgame.name: Cyberpunks & Cadillacs
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You are cyberpunks en route via Cadillac on a very dangerous road. With the GM behind the wheel, will you be able to survive this vicious road ahead?

boardgame.name: Legacy of Atmos: The Tellus Crusade
boardgame.description:
Legacy of Atmos is a game of epic tactical skirmish-based warfare for 2-4 players with deck-building elements and a character fate and alignment system!

You will command a small force of legendary Characters and models that are fighting a battle which forms part of the larger on-going conflict.
This box set’s release follows the events of Highlord Godrey Ronin and his crusade against the mysterious Tellus Commune.
Will you choose to defend the mystical Tellus Forest, with their strange creatures and savage Karath Tribes, or pursue Godrey’s quest for his House's vengeance?

The game is played by first selecting your Legendary Character and building your army and deck list. Players will fight over zones of control that increase their Supremacy Points at the end of each round. Each player will also bring with them 3 secret "Gambits" with them into a game. These Gambits support an intense variety of playstyles and gives the player Supremacy Points when completed. The player with the most Supremacy Points at the end of 5 battle rounds wins the game!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Mummy: The Curse (2nd Ed)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

I wield the might of gods, the powers of the elements, control over the living and the dead, and yet I cannot tell you my name. It is unknown to me, in a darkened corner of my memory, and I do not know when illumination shall reach me.

I awoke in this ancient tomb, a crack in its roof introducing fresh air for the first time in what feels like centuries. At my feet, three broken bodies. I vaguely recall shattering them with my fists, or maybe it was with my roar. They disturbed me; now they are dead.

What I know is that gods unimaginable to the rank and file of mortality alternate between goading, tempting, cajoling, and encouraging me. They want me to wake from my slumber, seek out their vessels of power, and return them to the land of the dead, where I might sleep again.

I creak and pop my way into motion, Sekhem fusing and pulsating in my desiccated body — my sahu — and I take in my surroundings. Writings on the walls in languages long forgotten, but slowly returning to my mind. They tell me what I am.

I am a mummy. I am Arisen. I have awoken to serve, but as a god among mortals, I will be worshiped. I will live again. My memory shall return, my power shall wane, and at the end of the tale, I will know all.

I feel hungry mouths approaching my shattered tomb. The time for contemplation is over. I may know my name tomorrow, but before then I will feel the spatter of blood on my skin and the splitting of flesh and bone between my fingers.

Mummy: The Curse includes:


Everything you need to run or play Mummy: The Curse, a game of timeless horror and multiple eras of mystery.
A deep setting of Iremite history and society, delving into the world of the Arisen and other immortals, sorcerers, and cultists.
Powers ranging from the cosmic to the subtle, all at the beck and call of this game’s protagonists.
A plethora of horrifying foes, from Blood Bathers to Body Thieves, Lifeless Shuankhsen to chimerical Amkhata, and many more.
Comprehensive storytelling advice to make Mummy accessible and enthralling to everyone from their first session.

boardgame.name: Elementa Arcanum
boardgame.description:
Welcome to the world of Elementa Arcanum. Hundreds of years in the future, scientific advances have given humans control over the power behind the elemental forces of nature: Fire, Water, Wind and Earth. Through genetic engineering, the richest families of the galaxy have evolved a race of superhuman wizards. The strongest representatives of each generation participate in a galactic tournament once a year called the Elementa Arcanum -- a spectacle so mesmerizing it surpassed the Olympics and rendered it obsolete. As the years pass, the most talented of each generation slowly begin to emerge until a victor is declared. The winner is named the Elementa Prima and dons the Black Hole Robes, forever etched into history. Will you wield Ultima and master the 4 Elements?

Elementa Arcanum is a deck-building card game for 1-6+ players. Players alternate between Combat Turns, where they vie for Stars (Victory Points) and Research Turns where players can improve and optimize their decks. The first player to 5 Stars wins the game. The rules are relatively simple and can be taught to newcomers while the game is underway through the "Teaching Game" system. The game has a very small form-factor and is highly portable. A common shop containing new cards for players to acquire uses a tiered system and uses rules to prevent shop stagnation.

boardgame.name: Princess of the Universe (Fate)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Get ready for action figure fantasy in the tradition of She-Ra and He-Man, powered by Fate!







Here you stand, bearing arms in the name of Virtue against the arrayed villains of the distant planet Eidolon.

You have great powers, and great responsibilities, and you are entirely up to the challenge of both.

The challenge to be...

PRINCESS OF THE UNIVERSE!

Epic Heroism.

Robot Warriors.

Queer Inclusion.

Snake Queens.

In Princess of the Universe, you’ll create your own toy line -- including heroes, villains, vehicles, and playsets -- and then deploy them into action across the battleground of the exotic world of Eidolon!

Choose your persona -- are you Haunted by what you’ve done? Are you the group’s grizzled Mentor? Perhaps you're the Stalwart whose moral compass everyone relies on? Your persona gives you access to stunts that shape your interactions with your comrades!

Pick your action feature, ranging from Built-In Grappling Hook to Power Punch to Shooting Sparks or even Slime. Your action feature gives you custom stunts reflecting your iconic powers -- then round it out with cool accessories!

And you know how the best parts of cartoons tend to be the baddies? You get to play both a hero and a villain in each episode, with group creation rules that set you up for both dysfunction and bonding. The GM takes control of the group-designed Archvillain, in charge of coming up with vile schemes for her henchmen to carry out and the heroes to thwart!

That’s right, the GM gets to do the Skeletor voice!

Under the hood, Princess of the Universe uses a lean build of Fate that’s fully integrated into the book -- you don’t need any other books! If you’re already familiar with Fate, we include a quick reference to the additions and modifications.

For everyone who lived for fantasy cartoons and desperately wanted all of the toys, this game is for you!

boardgame.name: Ringborg Dwarven Hold Mines
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The dwarves have started up mining operations again, utilizing the old tunnels while expanding the mine deeper into the mountain.The result is a vast network of tunnels and caverns with track laid throughout.

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 50x100 depicting a Dwarven mine, filled with tunnels and mine tracks.

boardgame.name: Ringborg Dwarven Hold Upper Level
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This former mine has been significantly widened and heavily reworked into an impressively carved Hold with bas-relief walls and ornate columns supporting the roof.

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 50x50 maps depicting a Dwarven hold, built into an old mine. It features a great hall, a temple, tavern, market and homes.

boardgame.name: Ringborg Dwarven Hold Ancient Level
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Enormous stone guardians stand in silent watch to both sides of this vast hallway, their stern visages staring down on the empty space.

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 50x70 depicting an ancient Dwarven hold, filled with traps. Includes overlays for the drained corridors, and the trapped corridor.

boardgame.name: Ravenkeep
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Carved from the rock of the mountainside by dwarves of a forgotten age, the Ravenkeep has been home to the heroes and villains of a hundred sagas.The ancient stone has repelled the assault of giants, resisted the fire of linnorms, and withstood the wrath of Wodagr, when the god of the sea vented his displeasure against the foolishness of a most stubborn jarl.

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 50 x 50 map depicting a Ravenkeep - an imposing fortress built into the mountain. It guards a huge block of ice containing a frozen danger! Includes exterior version

boardgame.name: Ringborg Harbour
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A pier and a few scattered buildings made of stone do not offer a promising impression of this young settlement, but then you see the towering dwarven visage carved in the rock face and the constant foot traffic of busy dwarves passing in and out of its mouth, beyond which the real Ringborg lies.

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A set of 30x50 maps depicting a Dwarven harbour and entrance to a Hold. Includes interior and exterior versions, and ship/no-ship versions too.

boardgame.name: Relick TCG
boardgame.description:
Relick is a card game that recreates the relick manga battles in which you will have to create your deck with one of the characters from the series and fight with different weapons and objects from retro video games such as the power glove and the plumber's star!

In the game, each player chooses a character that has a number of life points, in each turn the players can: draw 1 card, attack, use 2 cards from their hand or level up. To win you have to attack your opponent with the attack dice, if you hit the result of the dice you will subtract life points from the opponent, you can also use other cards that will allow them to reach this objective faster, when a player reaches life 0, don't lose the game, but if you manage to hurt him one more time with at least 1 damage, you win the game.

—description from the designer

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Stolki's Hall
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A traditional longhouse of great size, Stolki’s features multiple long wooden tables with bench seating where food is served morning and night and the mead flows until well after dark.
A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A set of 20 x 30 map depicting a Norse style meadhall. Included are day & night variants, and exterior and interior views.

boardgame.name: The City of Bense
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bense’s populations of roughly three thousand souls live in wattle-and-daub homes or timber and log houses caulked with clay
A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A set of 70 x 76 maps depicting a Norse town with dozens of wooden and thatch houses. Day & night versions, plus 2 interiors.

boardgame.name: The Knattleikr Field
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The favourite ball game of Norrøngard, Knattleikr is a rough sport that frequently results in injuries andeven the death of its players. Played with wooden bats and a hard ball, a single game can last from sunup to sundown or even for several days.

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 20 x 30 map depicting a Knattleikr field - a sports field in a woodland clearing.

boardgame.name: The Mounds
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Visitors to Bense are advised to mind the examples of the locals and never venture into the Mounds after sunset

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A set of 30 x 40 maps depicting a field of barrow mounds. Day & Night versions are provided. A full set of tunnels and barrow interiors, leading to a sinister games arena..

boardgame.name: Felbrir Flamebeard's Longhouse
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Felbrir Flamebeard’s Longhouse is an impressive structure, worked from top to bottom and end to end in elaborate carvings depicting the illustrious history of the city and its many heroes.

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A set of 20 x 30 map depicting a Norse style longhouse. Included are day & night variants, and exterior and interior views.

boardgame.name: The Wave Maiden
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Uðr Møy (“the Wave Maiden”) is a longship in the karvi style, approximately 75 feet long with sixteen rowing positions

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 20 x 30 map depicting the Wave Maiden, a karvi style Norse longship

boardgame.name: Longship
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Drakkar style longship

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 20 x 30 map depicting a drakkar style norse longboat

boardgame.name: Longship Battle
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A pale, green light, faint at first but growing swiftly, emanates from below the dark waters off the starboard side of the Uðr Møy. Suddenly, in a billow of foam, an ancient, rotting longship, covered in barnacles and draped in seaweed, rises from the waters
A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 30 x 30 map depicting the battle between a draugr undead longship and a smaller norse karvi longboat.

boardgame.name: Draugr Longship
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A drakkar style longship, crewed by the dead!

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 20 x 30 map depicting drakkar style Norse/Viking longship

boardgame.name: Bild-A-Word for Tots
boardgame.description:
A version of the game Bild-A-Word made for preschoolers and kindergarteners. Whereas the original game has letters on the cards, this one also has numbers, colors, and pictures.

From an advert for it:
"Make the Bobbys, The Bettys and the Johnnys of pre-school or Kindergarten age happy -- by giving them

BILD-A-WORD
for TOTS
"A Kindergarten Education in Itself"

Start them right with games that teach as they amuse. BILD-A-WORD for TOTS is based on the methods employed in the schoos today. It is a game and a toy that teaches little minds colors, numerals, picture construction and spelling."

boardgame.name: Flames of Freedom: Core Rulebook
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

It is the dawn of the American Revolutionary War of 1776.

A tangled web of conspiracy spans North America. In the war for survival, it does not matter your creed, color, culture or gender - all stand together. But as the Revolution has begun, something far more mysterious stirs. Agents of the occult entreat both the Continental Army and the Red Coats. Freemasons conspire in the City of Brotherly Love. Maryland is in the throes of a witch hunt by the Knights Templar.

Reports of witches have been seen in the Great Dismal Swamp. Indigenous sachem say that devils walk among the living. Flesh-gobbling ghouls have been tunneling beneath Boston. The Pine Barrens of New Jersey are haunted by what the locals call the Leeds Devil.

In this game, most people have either chosen to deny the supernatural or rationalize it away. A rare few accept it for what it is and act. You are among those heroes and are destined for greatness... or death.

This American Gothic horror game includes most of what you need to play: a player's handbook, a game master's guide, a bestiary and an introductory adventure with a sandbox campaign set in and around Boston. All that's left are a few friends, pencils, and a handful of dice.

Welcome to Flames of Freedom, where your Grim & Perilous tale hangs in the balance!

boardgame.name: BaF: Panther
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Panther is an awakened, large feline. The Panther is not some mere animal companion or familiar, but a fully realized, awakened adventurer and a valuable asset to any party.

Basic Witch Games presents our second class in our BaF (Basic as F***) line of OSR content: The Panther.

The Panther is a fully realized 9 level class, completely compatible with any B/X style fantasy game. This PDF also two new magic items and two new fearsome foes!

boardgame.name: BaF: The Muse
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Muse is a Magic User who uses their arcane talents to sway emotions and enchant their companions.

Basic Witch Games presents our first class in our BaF (Basic as F***) line of OSR content: The Muse.

The Muse is a fully realized 14 level class, completely compatible with any B/X style fantasy game. This PDF also includes 10 new Spells, and a new beautifully illustrated Magic Sword!

boardgame.name: Marked for Slaughter
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Marked for Slaughter is a thrilling 5e adventure that takes you deep into the underbelly of a sinister slaughterhouse and its ritualistic cult. From the outside, the slaughterhouse looks like you'd expect, but as your party of adventurers will soon find out, extreme horror lurks within.

This unique, standalone adventure is a fun step along the way of your homebrew campaign experience. This single dungeon adventure is perfect for a party of 4 player characters ranging between levels 7 to 9.

This challenging adventure explores the mysterious ways of the Cult of Flesh, their unsuspecting slaughterhouse, and cannibalistic obsessions. Players can expect a combination of roleplay, skill, and combat encounters as they uncover this sinister environment.

For your party to be ready to venture forth, they should have an appetite for life-threatening, dangerous adventures. They will need cunning skills and a stocked inventory to overcome the challenges facing them.

Whatever brings you and your party to the slaughterhouse, only being Marked for Slaughter gets you into its underbelly!

boardgame.name: The Summit
boardgame.description:
Humanity has survived the apocalypse and settled into tribes across the landscape. Can the leaders of the tribes find a way to compromise and make room for a new nation, or descend back into chaos?

In The Summit, you’ll either work with the other players, or work against them to make your own new world. This is a negotiation game with a traitor mechanic, but only you decide when you’re the traitor.

boardgame.name: Flipping & Turning (Issue 3 - Spring 2021)
boardgame.description:
Annals of the Grog Empire... Monk Edition!

Flipping & Turning

Spring 2021
boardgame.rpgissue: Flipping & Turning: The Annals of the Grog Empire

boardgame.name: Flipping & Turning (Issue 4 - Summer 2021)
boardgame.description:
Flipping & Turning

Annals of the Grog Empire

Summer 2021
boardgame.rpgissue: Flipping & Turning: The Annals of the Grog Empire

boardgame.name: Diecraft
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is an RPG-lite; meaning there aren’t narrative roles to be acted out here. Players are mostly concerned with keeping their characters alive, and chasing objectives. From the creator of Table Games, Diecraft is a labor of love for fans of Minecraft, and the role-playing genre. With a lower learning curve, and clearer priorities than the majority of RPGs on the market, Diecraft sets out to give users an addictive experience which can be appreciated by almost anyone. Games which have typically taken entire nights to play can now be enjoyed in a matter of hours. Your characters will level up from one game to the next. And, the path to winning is unlikely to ever be the same; thanks to the randomized scoring system, and alternating goals. If you've tried other RPGs, and love their premise, but sometimes wish for more focus on action than on words, then this game may be right for you.

boardgame.name: The Walking Dead: Call to Arms – Rick's Group Faction Pack
boardgame.description:
Through eﬀort and sacriﬁce, Rick and his friends and family have managed to survive the harsh new world. Although they have managed to obtain a measure of peace as a group, they will need to be ready to ﬁght both the walkers and other survivors to keep it.

—description from the publisher

This faction starter set contains: 5 plastic Survivors (Rick in riot armor, Glenn in riot armor, Andrea, Maggie, and Michonne); 2 plastic Walkers (Mike & Terry); 6 Character Cards; and 5 Equipment Cards. The miniatures are supplied assembled and unpainted.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: The Walking Dead – All Out War
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: The Walking Dead: Call to Arms

boardgame.name: The Walking Dead: Call to Arms – Prisoner Booster Pack
boardgame.description:
You can boost your chosen gang with the addition of the Prisoner Booster Pack. Luckily the Prisoners aren't fussy who they work for, so they'll make perfect allies for Rick or the Governor.

—description from the publisher

This faction starter set contains: 4 plastic Survivors (Dexter, Axel, Andrew, and Thomas); 5 Character Cards; and 2 Equipment Cards. The miniatures are supplied assembled and unpainted.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: The Walking Dead – All Out War
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: The Walking Dead: Call to Arms

boardgame.name: The Russian Revolutions: 1914-21
boardgame.description:
'During the first two months of 1917 Russia was still a Romanov monarchy. Eight months later the Bolsheviks stood at the helm. They were little known to anybody when the year began, and their leaders were still under indictment for state treason when they came to power. You will not find another such sharp turn in history especially if you remember that it involves a nation of 150 million people...'
Leon Trotsky, History of the Russian Revolutions

The Russian Revolutions: 1914-21 is a social-political conflict game for 2 to 5 players. In the game, players take on the role of one of five factions (Monarchists, Octobrists, Cadets (Constitutional Democrats), Left Reformists, or the Revolutionary Left) active in the events of the Russian Revolutions of 1917. Some factions begin the game as Governing factions with state power; others as the opposition. Whatever your factions, you will need to build your political influence, maintain your military power, manage alliances with other factions, and protect Russia from foreign invaders. The winner of the game is the faction that gains state power, and uses that effectively to change Russian society as its ideology dictates.

The game is played on two boards, one depicting the European part of Russia, the other representing St. Petersburg/ Petrograd (Russia's capital city and the 'cradle of the revolution'). Political influence is represented by coloured blocks; a vast range of historical leaders as well as military units (with historical designations) are represented by colourful double-sided chits.

The game uses an innovative system in which player either spend 'action points' to take actions or to buy cards, and thereby gain influence among various significant institutions, organisations, and social groups which can be used in later turns. Historical events are affect play as they are drawn from time-tiered event decks. New cards are added to these decks as certain conditions are met in game play.

Unlike most political games, the Russian Revolutions: 1914-21 is very suitable for solitaire play. There is little hidden information and, while alliances between factions is an important part of play, these alliances are formed and broken automatically as the ideological position of you faction changes through the game. That means there is no need for long breaks in play where players 'negotiate' and scheme - all your scheming will happen on the board.

boardgame.name: Forgotten Treasure: Cursed Treasure Expansion
boardgame.description:
A 54 card expansion pack for Forgotten Treasure. This expansion adds brings a bunch of new cards to the game and expands the game to 2-6 players (from 2-4).

This expansion also adds an alternate win condition: There are 6 Item cards with skulls on them; If you hold 4 of these cards in your hand at the end of your turn, you win the game!

boardgame.name: Blood Vessels
boardgame.description:
From the description:

you were created for war.

you were built somewhere terrible and austere. your pieces came from places the galaxy wide, planets that your creators, the colonizers, clutch like strangling vines.

you must make your own path now.

blood vessels is a solo roleplaying game about a single spaceship, once created for war, now taken in by various bands of misfits, finding its own way in a universe it was designed to ruin.

this game is a hack of Jack Harrison's Bucket of Bolts and was designed for the Lost & Found Game Jam!

boardgame.name: Kohaku: Sundials Expansion
boardgame.description:
The Sundials mini-expansion offers two new ways to score your koi ponds.

The first is the "Sundials" scoring, which gives each player a sundial with N, S, W, and E directions. The sundial is a feature for your garden and each player is dealt 4 cards to place around it. Each player will score bonus points for correctly positioning koi and/or features in their pond according to the relative direction of their sundial cards. This expansion includes 4 sundials and 13 sundial cards.

The second is the "Hidden Objectives" scoring. Each player will be dealt 2 cards and will keep 1 of them. The chosen card is kept secret from other players and will be revealed at the end of the game. Points earned from the hidden card will be added to the score from your pond. This expansion includes 12 cards.

boardgame.name: Lost Empires: Crown of Ashes
boardgame.description:
The war is not over! Reap the most alien artifacts to build your worm gate and crush the enemy factions in this expansion for the asymmetric area control card game, Lost Empires!

This expansion for Lost Empires: War for the New Sun, provides players with all the content required to play the game at higher player counts. Now, Lost Empires can be played with 3-4 players, or in 2v2 teams.

Note that the Kickstarter edition of Crown of Ashes also includes the components to play solo (listed separately).
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Lost Empires: War for the New Sun

boardgame.name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Saviors Cards Pack
boardgame.description:
This pack contains the cards necessary to use the miniatures for Negan and his lieutenants from The Walking Dead: Here's Negan – The Board Game in games of The Walking Dead: All Out War and The Walking Dead: Call to Arms. This pack does not contain miniatures.

This pack includes the Character Cards for 6 Survivors (Negan, Dwight, Sherry, John, Laura, and Tara) and 3 Equipment Cards. These are the same cards that are included in The Walking Dead: All Out War – Saviors Faction Pack.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: The Walking Dead – All Out War
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Saviors Faction Pack
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: The Walking Dead: All Out War
The Walking Dead: All Out War Collector's Edition
The Walking Dead: Call to Arms

boardgame.name: Lost Empires: Solo Mode
boardgame.description:
The war for the new sun has only just begun! Reap the most alien artifacts to build your worm gate and crush the enemy factions in this solitaire expansion for the asymmetric area control card game, Lost Empires!

This expansion for Lost Empires: War for the New Sun, provides players with all the content required to play the game solo. Compete against 4 different AI opponents with variable difficulty modes.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Lost Empires: War for the New Sun

boardgame.name: Fave Game: Classic Version
boardgame.description:
How well do you know everyone at the table? Think they can guess your favourite things? Find out in Fave Game!

Each round one player is named 'The Fave'. Players choose cards from their hand that 'The Fave' will like best. 'The Fave' will put the cards in preferential order and the top three cards score points.

The Fave will place the cards face down in order from most favoured to least favoured. The Fave will show them in order, starting from their least favoured card, explaining why they chose to rate each card in the way that they did. Longer, funnier, and crazier stories are recommended!
When all cards have been shown, the most favoured card will earn the player who gave it three points. Second place is worth two points and third place is worth one point. The shown cards are used as score markers and players who win points will keep them face up to track their points.
The game ends when everyone has been The Fave an equal amount of times and the score cards are counted. The person with the most points wins!

boardgame.name: 18 Holes: Putting, Wind and Coastlines
18 Holes: Reading the greens
boardgame.description:
Tame the wind, play along rugged coastlines and take the competition all the way to the green in this expansion for 18 Holes.

In Reading the Greens, players now need to consider their approach to the green to ensure they have the easiest putt. A Green deck is added to keep the challenge fresh for every hole. Includes new golfers, new clubs, player actions and once on the green, custom dice are used to sink the putt.

In Taming the Wind players can choose how they will work with the wind, allowing for shots that were not possible before. The Coastline pack includes new double-sided course tiles that bring the beautiful coastlines, precarious greens and new hazards.

This expansion is compatible with both the first and second edition of 18 Holes.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Lady's Choice
boardgame.description:
Can you impress the lady enough to win her hand in marriage? Will you be the perfect choice, or will you take all her love and give nothing back? And on your turn to be the lady, will you find true love, or heart break?

Lady's Choice is a light bluffing game about the ugly side of romance.

Each card has a dandiness value. Some cards stop other cards from scoring. The cards that DO score (positive or negative) are totalled for a dandiness value of the gentleman. This is used to calculate the dandiness ranking. (Most Dandy, Second most, and so on.)

The married gentleman gains points according to his rank. 1st? 1 point. 2nd? 2 points, and so on. Also an extra point if he's the worst. The lady gains points according to the reverse of her husband's rank. Worst? No points. Second worst? 1 point. Third worst? 2 points, and so on. Also an extra point if he's the best.

Everyone gets to be the lady once and marry once. Once all players have been the lady, the game ends.

Most points at the end wins.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Utmost Savagery
boardgame.description:
This solitaire game portrays the battle for the island of Peleliu, which was the hardest-fought and most difficult campaign the 1st Marine Division would ever engage in.
The Japanese on Peleliu were dug in and ready to give the overconfident Americans a blistering fight. Unlike previous island invasions, in which the Marines had crushed ill-prepared defenders, Peleliu would become a strategic nightmare for the Americans.

The Japanese had spent months building defensive fortifications and turning the island into a death trap. Bombarded by battleships and hammered by Corsairs dropping tons of napalm, the Japanese held on and withstood the initial invasion. Skillful night attacks and relentless artillery barrages made the Americans pay dearly for every inch taken.
The terrible 115-degree heat and endless combat sapped American morale and turned a battle projected to be won in 4 days into a vicious 6-week campaign. With the aid of the reinforcing 81st Infantry Division the Marines would eventually win at Peleliu, but the cost was devastatingly high.

You, as the American Player, have a limited amount of time to destroy all 30 Japanese Counters from the map. You win the game as soon as the last enemy counter is destroyed, but lose at any time the Morale Track reaches the 1 box, or the last Time Chit of Level IV Intensity is drawn with Japanese Counters still in play.
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Islands of the Damned: Wake Island and Peleliu

boardgame.name: Given Up for Dead
boardgame.description:
At Wake Island an outnumbered Marine Defense Battalion showed the world what they were made of when they fought off a Japanese landing force and secured America’s first but very fleeting victory in World War II.

The Japanese flush with victory after ravaging Pearl Harbor turned their sights to the small strategic island but failed to account for the courage and tenacity of the defenders. Instead of an easy victory, the Japanese were handed their first defeat when two of the attacking destroyers were sunk with all hands lost. The surprising victory immortalized this small coral atoll as the Alamo of the Pacific.

In this solitaire game, you as the American player must hold out for as long as possible against the overwhelming Japanese force arrayed against you. Victory Points are gained by the number of Invasion Attempt Counters revealed and enemy ships placed Out of Action. While it is unlikely you will be able to defeat the invasion force in full, you might be able to change the outcome of the Pacific War by making the invasion of Wake Island a very costly and tragic victory for the Japanese.
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Islands of the Damned: Wake Island and Peleliu

boardgame.name: Reise durch Afrika
boardgame.description: The players start at space 1 (Rabat). Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces, events (from the rules booklet or information cards) hinder or benefit the players and points get awarded or deducted. The game ends when the first player reaches space 78 (Addis-Abeba). The player with the most points wins the game.

boardgame.name: Flucht aus London
boardgame.description:
The Escape game for London fans.

In this gritty escape thriller, players must crack tricky puzzles and encrypted codes to escape from the English metropolis. The gripping escape story takes them to London's most popular landmarks such as Big Ben, London Eye and many more.

--publisher's description

boardgame.name: Das Escape-Dinner: Ein kulinarisches Escape-Abenteuer in 3 Gängen
boardgame.description:
After a nuclear catastrophe, the surface of the earth is devastated and most of the population destroyed. For decades, a handful of survivors have held out in the bunker - until the supplies run out and they decide to find an exit. But all ways out seem firmly closed.

Those who want to survive this apocalyptic Escape Dinner must not only prove their intuition and excellent powers of deduction, but also manage their supplies well: Only when a puzzle has been solved, the next course may be served. Teamwork, stamina and a cool head are required here.

Find your way out of the bunker – but share your supplies well Because if you want to survive this apocalyptic escape dinner, you need not only prove sense and combination skills, but also keep good households. Solve the puzzles together to get to your supplies and slowly find the way into freedom.

boardgame.name: Pralinen für dich: Das Spiel für clevere Naschkatzen
boardgame.description:
This fun party game is the perfect alternative to rich chocolate gifts. Instead of sugar-sweet calorie bombs, the recipient gets an exciting game of tile-laying in which the aim is to create the most exquisite bouquets of chocolates and give them to his or her fellow players. But watch out: To become a true Maître Chocolatier and win at this game, you need a watchful eye, a gift for combination and a clever mind. This is the only way to create the most gifts of chocolates and emerge as the winner.

The winner here is the player who was able to give away the most boxes of chocolates to his fellow players at the end. To assemble the perfect selection, you must follow the instructions on your order cards. But beware: you need imagination, a good eye and a lot of dexterity to create the perfect chocolate variation.

At the beginning, each player receives order cards on which certain praline arrangements are depicted. The players now have to reconstruct these on the moving playing field, following 4 swapping rules. Once you have completed an order, the order card is gift-wrapped and you may give it to one of your fellow players.

When one of you has given away his last order card, the game is over. However, the player who finishes first does not automatically win. It is much more decisive to whom he has given his praline creations - and whether he has also received plenty of gifts from the others. So it remains exciting for everyone until the points are counted.

boardgame.name: Arschloch Extreme: Mit Sonderkarten für noch mehr Nervenkitzel
boardgame.description:
Normal "Asshole" (German game name: "Arschloch") was yesterday!

In this new variant, it's all about committing the nastiest deeds possible to gain an advantage and end up on the throne. Special cards give players superpowers that let them see through cards, give them magnetic hands, or let them slip cards to other players.

At the end of three rounds of play, the player who has played the meanest to his fellow players wins.

boardgame.name: Deutschland-Wanderung
boardgame.description:
The players start at the starting spaces, representing a hiking club corresponding of their choice with a capital of 100 points. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. Often points are awarded or deducted. On the roll of a 3 or 6 the player gets to chose to move his piece or draw an event card. At the roll of a 1 the player gets another turn.

After an agreed on amount of time the game ends and the player with the most points is the winner.

The address of the publisher has a pre 1992 zip code and the game map shows only West Germany it places the game before 1990.
The use of a tube instead of a box indicates that the game was most likely published in the 1980's or late 70's.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Canteen
boardgame.description:
From the description:

You were created. You were passed down. You remember every steward who has held you in their hands.

In this game, the player takes the role of an object from the kitchens of a dozen different stewards. Through the object, the player experiences the joy of cooking, the pleasure of eating, the success of fame, and the quiet obscurity of a home cook.

This game is based on the Lost & Found game system, designed by Jack Harrison. Canteen was written for the Lost & Found jam.

boardgame.name: Transcend
boardgame.description:
A single-player card stacking game. A test of strategy, luck, and concentration based on the solitaire-style card game Calculation.

Players begin with four base piles (which can only be built on following a sequence going from atomic to galactic) and four empty stock piles (which can be built on in any order).
Shuffle the deck and draw one card at a time. These must either be placed on a base pile (if possible) or one of the stock piles. Cards can also be moved from stock piles to base piles.

The aim is to use up all cards to complete the sequence on the four base piles.
If you reach the end of the deck and still have cards in stock piles that can't be moved, you lose!

Work out the optimum strategy for success (it's all down to how you order your stock piles, and a bit of luck). A good player can complete the game 1 out of 4 times, but can you do better?

boardgame.name: Star Wars: Bordure extérieure – Affaires en Suspens
Star Wars: El Borde Exterior – Asuntos Pendientes
Star Wars: Outer Rim – Offene Rechnungen
Star Wars: Outer Rim – Unfinished Business
Star Wars: Peremvidék – Befejezetlen Ügyletek
Star Wars: Zewnętrzne Rubieże – Niedokończone Sprawy
boardgame.description:
You’ve made a name for yourself in the Outer Rim, but there is still Unfinished Business. Hyperlanes through the Core Worlds hold the promise of untapped opportunities. The market is flush with new merchandise, from valuable cargo to tools of the trade. Just watch your step; the latest crop of bounties is even deadlier, and your rivals are looking to take you down!

Unfinished Business, an expansion for Star Wars: Outer Rim, is packed with more of everything the game has to offer: characters, ships, gear, bounties, jobs, encounters, dice, and more! Two new tiles allow players to cross the galaxy by passing through the Core Worlds, and the new “favors” and “ambitions” change up how the game is played. Fire up your engines—it’s time to get down to business.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Star Wars: Outer Rim – Premium reputation tokens

listing.notes:
Brand new copy of the game, in shrink wrap.
Shipping to EU would be 15 euro and the package should arrive in 7-10 days. Elsewhere – please ask!
Check out my other products for sale as well! If you buy multiple items, I will combine shipping costs. It’s much cheaper this way.

boardgame.name: I Was Once
boardgame.description:
From the description:

At the dawn of time, a deity forged you from their soul, their essence, their power. That power wanes. Inheritors have claimed you, taking your power for their own. Once, you made them gods. Then, you made them kings. Now, you make them human.

In 'I Was Once', you play as an Heirloom, a vessel of divine power. In Act 1, tell the story of the gods who claimed you and the strength you gave them. In Act 2, tell the story of the mortals who wielded you and how you made them more. In Act 3, tell a quiet tale of humans and stillness. The stories no one else will care about.

Content Warning: This game contains themes of mortality and abandonment. Use your judgement while playing and remember to take breaks.

boardgame.name: Rugby 15
boardgame.description:
A little game of bluff. Players use cards of different value and category (forward,back) to progress on the pitch.

The game is divided in 2 halves. A half ends when a player can't draw cards.

Each half is divided in rounds. For each round, the 2 players draw and discard cards to maintain a hand of 4 cards. the comparison of the value and type of cards gives the result : attacker progression on the pitch or ball winned by defender

The winner is the player with the higher score at the end of the match.

boardgame.name: Descent: Legends of the Dark – Ghosts of Greyhaven
boardgame.description:
Descent: Legends of the Dark – Ghosts of Greyhaven can be incorporated as a side story in the Act I campaign included in Descent: Legends of the Dark, or it can be played as a standalone adventure, although presumably using components from the earlier standalone game.

This expansion will add a series of additional quests to the base game revolving around a side story for the heroes to delve into. It is expected to add an unknown number of monsters which can also be integrated into the base game and future expansions. As well as a potential new hero for the players to meet and have join their party. Additional tiles and card board terrain similar to the base game will also be included.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: 18 Holes: Course Architect
boardgame.description:
There is an adage, the million-dollar deal is done on the golf course. The deals shouldn't be happening yet as your still designing the course now. Yet, every week, the planning committee arrives to tell you what deals they made over the weekend and now you have to adjust your plans to suit. Can you handle the whims of the committee and design the best golf course with what fate has given you.

18 Holes: Course Architect is a roll-and-write where you compete to create a golf course while satisfying the whims of the Course Planning Committee. Each round the committee dice are rolled revealing the greens, fairways and hazards that need to be placed. All players place what is shown on the dice onto their course. Players score points by designing holes of the correct length, well-placed hazards, chained holes and secret bonuses. The person scoring the most points will be regarded as the greatest course architect!
