boardgame.name: Super-Chance
boardgame.description:
Super-Chance is a dice racing game with a background in traffic education. Players roll the dice and drag their pieces along a winding path to the finish line. Those who are lucky may use shortcuts. Along the way, the meaning of traffic signs is explained. The player who gets his 3 figures to the finish line first wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Fenix (No. 5, 2020 - English only)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This issue had less articles in English than usual, but we are very happy with the one we got! Pete Nash has revamped an old scenario he made for Elric! – even though you of course could play it with your favorite game with just a few minor adjustments. The adventure comes complete with 7 player characters each presented on their separate character sheets, which allows you to start playing right off the bat!

boardgame.name: Fenix (No. 6, 2020 - English only)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fenix #6, 2020 is full to the brim. It is our food issue, featuring articles like Fantastic Feasts on how to add a fantasy twist to a banquet by Graeme Davis and Food for the Gods, a wry tale of Mythological Comestibles and the Powers they Provide for Mythras, by Pete Nash. Once again you get a full on adventure to play, this time The Chasm of Erdugald to Symbaroum. It is 10 page scenario signed Paul Baldowski.

Food of the Gods – a 5 page article by Pete Nash
A Wry Tale of Mythological Comestibles and the Powers they Provide

T’was a dark and stormy night. Lightning tore across the sky, a flash of illumination revealing a strange white stone palace topped with oddly shaped onion domes. Moments later another bolt instead unveiled an ancient wooden temple deeply carved with knot-work.

Through the thunder a tall figure approached the strangely transient edifice. Teeth bared in a snarl, the warrior shrugged broad shoulders under his armour, feeling cold rain trickle down his back and slogged onwards towards what now seemed a ruin of vine covered marble columns

Fantastic Feasts – a 4 page article by Graeme Davis
Graeme Davis on how to add a fantasy twist to a banquet

Almost every book, film, and TV show set in the European Middle Ages includes at least one feast, in which the king and his court sit at the high table above the great hall, consuming dish after lavish dish as the lower orders, ranged along benches below them, gorge on meat and ale. This is a comparatively rare scene in medieval fantasy games, though, and this is a pity. Here are some ideas for adding a fantasy twist to a banquet, complete with magic, monsters, and various kinds of peril.

The Chasm of Erdugald – a 10-page scenario for Symbaroum
The greatest dangers and most treacherous secrets of Davokar come not from the dark and trackless undergrowth or the twisted spires of ancient ruins, but from the unexpected and ever-changing features that seem to materialize from nothing and vanish without trace or warning. Any treasure-seeker worth their salt will never venture out lightly nor ill-prepared, and none will fall foul of the tricksters and charlatans who claim to have reliable maps to untold riches. The few landmarks that persist with certainty have been cleaned out of their easily accessible wealth. Those relics of ages past that have wealth to plunder have yet to be discovered or have only become accessible and may not stay open long. And occasionally, something more dangerous still will well up from the depths, offering the rarest of opportunities to those willing to risk their lives.

boardgame.name: Fenix (No. 1, 2021 - English only)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fenix #1, 2021 is centered around GHOSTS and the UNDEAD, but you will also find some fun and interesting interviews, articles and a scenario to new and upcoming games such as Jim Henspn’s The Labyrinth and Cora Quest. Graeme Davis introduces you to some Fortified Spirits and Pete Nash goes straight for More Undead Horrors on Monster Island.

Fortified Spirits – a 4 pages article by Graeme Davis
Graeme Davis on how to add variety and keep players on their toes

Most fantasy and horror games divide incorporeal undead into a small number of types — the most common are banshee, ghost, specter, and wraith — and every individual of a particular type is identical to every other. This article takes a systemless look at the properties and abilities of incorporeal undead, drawn from folklore and paranormal studies as well as from various game rules, and proposes a way to create individuals that will add variety to your games and keep players on their toes.

More Undead Horrors for Monster Island – a 4 pages article by Pete Nash
As if the infamous isle was not scary enough, in this issue we take a look at yet more nasty beings that infest its humid jungles...

Undead are the nightmare horror of every fantasy world. Paradoxical things that straddle the razor’s edge betwixt life and death. Creatures that cannot be killed, since they are already dead, yet still remain animate to haunt the living… somewhat akin to a cross between Schroedinger’s Cat and the unending nightmare of government bureaucracies

Jim Henson’s Labyrinth the Adventure Game – 2 pages interview with the Game Rules Author

An interesting conversation about a game based on the motion picture Labyrinth, from 1986, famously featuring David Bowie as Jareth, the Goblin King. Of course there are interesting questions and answers to be had about this game, not the least why and how it was made.

CoraQuest – a Dungeon Crawling Game for Children – a 2 pages introduction

Fenix board game editor Marcus Brissman got inspired by an upcoming board game by and for children. Here you get to know more about CoraQuest and its development.

4 Treasures and a Burial – a 2 pages scenario for CoraQuest

A halfling known for his large collection of hero memorabilia, approaches you with a quest: he wants four items that once belonged to the great hero Fenton Miller: His hat, his sword, his boots and his belt. If you could bring him all four he could put them in his hero museum and you’d get free admission for life. What a great reward!

Happily you set out on the adventure and soon find the dungeon where all the items had been seen last. This should be easy!
boardgame.rpg: Jim Henson's Labyrinth: The Adventure Game

boardgame.name: Kulcskérdés
Secret Identity
boardgame.description:
ln Secret Identity, you must guess the hidden identity of your opponents while trying to make them guess yours.

At the start of a round, you receive a key card that indicates your identity among the eight characters on the table. Using double-sided "picto" cards, you try to give clues to your character so that others can guess who you are, while simultaneously guessing their character — earning points for each success. Each round, new characters appear on the table, giving you and everyone else a fresh face to guess, but your supply of picto cards is never replenished, so you must be judicious when using them in order not to run out by game's end.

After the fourth round, whoever has scored the most points wins. Will you be able to act both as a skilled informant and a sharp observer?
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2022 UK Games Expo Best Party Game Judges Award Winner
2022 UK Games Expo Best Party Game Nominee

boardgame.name: Bring Out Yer Dead: Trick or Treat Bag and Token Set
boardgame.description: A purple velvet Bring Out Yer Dead bag along with a set of green translucent coffins and a first player token.

boardgame.name: Letters From the Leagues Volume 4
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

For Globetrotters Everywhere!

READ THE COLLECTIVE WISDOM GATHERED FROM THE LEAGUES!

Collected together for the first time are various articles and discourses from the illustrious members of the Leagues of Adventure, Leagues of Gothic Horror, and Leagues of Cthulhu.

Within these pages you will find:

New Leagues of Adventure: A smattering of new Leagues and a list giving you all the Leagues.
A Brief Guide to Liches: Everything you ever needed to know about liches (and not the undead variety).
The Enlightened order of the Serpent: A secret society written up for all three Leagues’ universes.
Masks: Donning a mask gives the Gamemaster to chance aspects of the campaign.
Hags: Deadly new hags!
Guide to Cumbria: New places to explore in Cumbria.
Even More Apparitions: A selection of deadly apparitions designed to terrify the globetrotters.
Doctor Sinister’s Occult Catalog: A new listing of occult relics.

boardgame.name: Galaxy Trucker: Rough Roads Mini-Expansion
boardgame.description:
This FREE mini-expansion, available now, only in a digital form, allows you to add one (or more) Rough Road cards to your flights.

These randomly added cards not only give you new fresh challenges – but you can bet that your ships will be falling apart again, while tears of despair and joy return to your eyes.

Rough Roads can be added to any single flight, and also to the Transgalactic Trek.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Star Trek: Missions
boardgame.description:
In Star Trek: Missions, you explore all the mystery and excitement of the galaxy, featuring characters, locations, and equipment in familiar groups or in strange new combinations. Assemble a crew with anyone from Commander Riker to DaiMon Bok, grab a Bat'leth, and take on challenges like organizing a Diplomatic Conference, or getting trapped in the Holodeck!

The combinations in each hand create a brand new episode of the Enterprise's continuing mission. Make the best combo to score the highest points and claim victory.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.commerceweblink: Geek Game Shop listing for Star Trek Missions A Fantasy Realms Game

Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups

listing.notes: Played Once.
Ship: $9
Title: Star Trek: Missions Publisher: WizKids Language(s): English

boardgame.name: The Gunblade: Warriors of Fire and Steel
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Become a master of fire and steel capable of both melee and short-ranged combat using explosives to enhance your melee strikes while relying on your close proximity to increase the deadliness of your point blank firearm shots. Choose to protect your allies and emphasize defense over raw power, make use of multiple gunblades to deliver rapid strikes, or specialize in two-handed weapons to deal massive damage in a single impact.

The Gunblade is a full new class for 5th edition, which provides an option for characters who wield bladed firearms, including:

3 subclasses: the Protector, Skirmisher, and Berserker
14 Infusions (special spell-like ammunition used by Gunblades)
8 new Bladed Firearm weapons
10 new types of crafted magical ammunition for firearms

boardgame.name: The Inventor: Masters of Technology and Creation
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Be a technological genius! Master the craft of destructive weapons, support your allies and disable your foes, or build a powered exoskeleton to enhance your own abilities!

The Inventor is a new class for 5th edition, which provides an option for characters who want to be technological masterminds:

3 specializations (subclasses): Offensive, Support, and Mech.
Rules for crafting items and acquiring special materials.
18 examples of “Gadgets”, class options akin to warlock invocations.
31 examples of Inventions to inspire your own creations!

boardgame.name: Mother of Night
Otherworldly Patron: Mother of Night
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Mother of Night is a new Otherworldly Patron for the 5th edition Warlock class. You have been chosen by a goddess of the night and the moon, blessing you with power to aid in deception, stealth, and dealing with creatures of the night. Gain the otherworldly power to “see” the minds of creatures near you, and wrap yourself in the shroud of night!

boardgame.name: 400 Follower Giveaway Special: Squirrel King Plumpkins
Squirrel King Plumpkins
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Squirrel King Plumpkins is terrorizing local towns in search of long-forgotten acorns and revenge against the tallfolk who drive squirrels away from their homes!

After uncovering the Great Acorn, Plumpkins was chosen for greatness, and gained fiendish powers, becoming the King of Squirrels!

Squirrel King Plumpkins provides a fun encounter for mid-level PCs who must fend off the Squirrel King and his dozens of swarming squirrel minions.

boardgame.name: Atoral
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Screams of fear and cries of agony sound in the night!

"The curse has come," they cry, "the Atoral has arrived!"

The Atoral is a cruel and twisted demonic spirit that travels the land speading terror and feeding on the suffering of its victims. Difficult to track down and even harder to slay, this monster will provide a challenging adventure for most parties!

boardgame.name: Consumptive Mass
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The precise origin of these abominations is unknown. Some theorize they may have begun as Otyughs which transformed after exposure to the waste products of some mad wizard’s experiments. Others believe it arrived directly from the far realms or the planes of chaos in some larval or seed-like state. Whatever its source, its numbers continue to grow and spread across the material plane like a plague of slugs.

This Monthly Monster provides all the lore, tactics, and stats you need to run it in your game, and provides inspiration for a slow, creeping threat for your players to deal with.

boardgame.name: Private Wiggins of the 17th Ornithopter Squadron
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Private Wiggins is a gnomish ornithopter pilot, ready to be dropped into your game as an NPC looking to guide your party to safety, or to keep them well away from the city he guards depending on your scenario!

Includes stats for Private Wiggins as well as stats for an Ornithopter mount!

boardgame.name: Tactical Assault Goblin
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Tactical Assault Goblin is a fun and somewhat unusual take on the stereotypical goblin - a heavily-armored, fully spiked, and ready to fight menace of steel!

Originially inspired by a joke from @RRollplaying on Twitter, the Tactical Assault Goblin will be a memorable encounter for players used to cowardly goblin foes.

boardgame.name: Awakened Cave
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The monster that is its own lair! Endless waves of creatures made of animated dirt fight to subdue the cave’s prey before dragging them into the depths to be consumed by the light of the cave’s ruby heart...

The Awakened Cave contains lore and rumors alongside the monster stat blocks to help you build an adventure around a soul-devouring cave!

boardgame.name: Dough Elemental and Bread Golem
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This special April Fools edition of Lone Colossus Games' Monthly Monster series will have your mouth watering at the delicious smell of yeast and baking bread. Useful for a surprise encounter at the kitchen of a master chef, or at the home of a skilled wizard, the Dough Elemental and Bread Constructs provide a veritable feast of delicious food fights.

Contains:

- The Dough Elemental, and its baked, Bread Golem form

boardgame.name: The Mycoshen
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Challenge your party with a monster that will take planning, research, and cunning to overcome! The mycoshen, second in a series of monthly monsters by Lone Colossus Games, is an immortal fungal creature, held in undeath by shrines maintained deep in its lair - the rotting core of an ancient and corrupted forest.

Contains the lore you’ll need for any inquisitive characters who research the creature, tactics, and combat statistics for running the mycoshen.

boardgame.name: Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Codex – Orks
boardgame.description:
There are many horrific alien threats to be found among the stars, and the Orks are some of the very greatest among them. Born for battle and possessed of an all-encompassing love for war, the average Ork is a heavily muscled killing machine able to withstand tremendous punishment and heal from all but the most grievous injuries. When they collect in colossal migratory invasions called Waaagh!s, the Orks stampede across whole sectors leaving a trail of destruction in their wake, wrought by ramshackle vehicles, cobbled-together weaponry, and sheer, primal savagery.

This 136-page book contains a treasure trove of background information covering prominent Ork conflicts from the past and present, accompanied by stunning artwork and galleries of painted miniatures. Codex: Orks grants you a detailed look into the organisation of Ork armies, be they small planetary raiding forces or monstrous Waaagh!s, as well as the troops, leaders, and war machines that fight among them. The book also has everything you need to know to field them in battle on the tabletop, including 61 datasheets, 7 Clan Kulturs, Stratagems, Relics, and more.

Inside this hardback codex, you'll find:


Thrilling tales of legendary Ork escapades, from war on a galactic scale to smaller, more 'covert' operations
All of the army rules you need to play games of Warhammer 40,000 with your Ork miniatures, including 61 datasheets covering every available unit
Lore on the six greatest Clans and the Freebooterz, including their unique kulturs and how Orks structure their armies
Detailed matched play rules, including dedicated secondary objectives
A full suite of rules for playing narrative Crusade games including Agendas, Battle Traits, Requisitions, Crusade Relics, Scrap, Might Makes Right, and more


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Lady Ursa Feldevin
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Lone Colossus Games' first in a series of monsters and NPCs produced monthly just for you! Lady Ursa Feldevin is a staunch ally and fearsome enemy. Regardless of how you encounter her, you're certain to have an adventure - just watch out for her claw!

Contains:

Lady Ursa Feldevin, a complete NPC with background information to help you run her and insert her into your setting, as well as a stat block for use in combat as either an ally or an enemy
Claw, a new magic weapon wielded by Lady Ursa

boardgame.name: Septenarius
boardgame.description:
Septenarius is a new take on the classic card collecting game Rummy and can be played Co-op. The game consists of 138 cards and is filled with various mythic creatures. The object of play is to form melds - combinations of three or more cards of the same rank - with or without the help of wild cards. The Pegasus and Faun are wild. . multiple rounds are played until a player or team reaches 6,000 points and wins the game.

2-3 player games are not played in teams. 4-8 players must pick partners. Partners sit opposite each other The dealer deals 10 cards face down to each player. The undealt remainder of the deck is placed face down in the center of the table, becoming the stock, and the top card is turned face up beside it.

Each player starts their turn by drawing one card and discarding one. players and teams collect cards and place melds down in front of them. Players add to these melds throughout the round to gain more points. If a player is able to get rid of all their cards on a turn, the round ends.

Everything that is on the table when a round ends counts as positive points. All cards left in players hands count as negative, even for the team that went out to end the round.
A player may meld as many cards as they please, of one rank or different ranks, forming new melds or adding cards to previous melds. All the melds of a partnership are placed in front of either partner.
—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Knock! (#2 - Sep 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Haven’t finished reading Knock! issue one? Well hurry up, the second volume is about to be sent to the printer. And it's even more full of gonzo goodness than the first one!

We did it again: we gathered some of the most respected, most creative, and possibly weirdest minds of the old school roleplaying scene and compiled some of their best work to make this thick magazine.

Once again, we made KNOCK! the overstuffed bric-à-brac we had dreamed of. We hope you still have some room on the part of your gaming shelf that's easy to reach from the gaming table!

This second issue is 224 pages It is filled with that old-school-slash-adventure-gaming unique flavour: thoughts about system and substance, useful rules and procedures, random tables and lists, pages of maps, six new classes, nine new monsters, and four complete adventures.

boardgame.name: One Hundred Plus Wartime Events
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The dreaded war has come to the realm; supplies are running low in the towns, people flee to safety and the brutal reality of the conflict creeps ever closer. What challenges will the kingdom face? What will happen to the young warriors who set out to prove themselves?
Presented here are 100 unique wartime events that are focused on realism and narrative-building roleplay. This list will help you bring the theme of war and conflict into your campaign and make it more nuanced and believable.
This is an essential tool and reference that a GM will be able to use over and over again.
1d100 adventure hooks and flavorful events for memorable roleplaying situations
Inspired by medieval history and real world events
Supernatural / magic references are kept to a bare minimum – gives you full control of the tone of your game
Almost exclusively non-combat content – keep using your favorite random encounter tables
Includes 12 additional support tables for excellent variation and further inspiration
Perfect for slice of life, OSR, historical and medieval fantasy games
System Agnostic – use with your favorite RPGs

boardgame.name: Articles of the Arcana
boardgame.description:
publisher blurb

"Tarot—much like Troika—is about interpretation, personal experience, and instinct."

The 84-page book contains 36 character backgrounds each inspired by a card in the tarot, including the entire Major Arcana. You'll also find new skills and spells for your character to utilize and 22 campaign prompts, each representing a part of the journey described in the Major Arcana. There are sections for incorporating your own tarot deck and using tarot draws to help run your game. It has everything you need to tarot your Troika!

Backgrounds are accompanied by tarot cards illustrated by Alex Perkins, Bri de Danann, Matthew Cartwright, and Thérèse Lanz. The book is rounded out with new skills, spells, and campaign and world-building advice, featuring art from Alec Sorensen and Amanda Franck. The stunning book cover is by Ignacio Paul.

boardgame.name: Chronicles of Avel
Die Chroniken von Avel
Le Cronache di Avel
Crónicas de Avel
Kroniki zamku Avel
Kroniky Avelu
boardgame.description:
Chronicles of Avel is a cooperative board game for the whole family. Take the role of brave heroes and heroines with a mission to save your magical land.

Create your character and give them a unique name. Get your equipment, upgrade it and prepare for battle. But remember to wisely choose what you carry as your backpack has limited space. Armed and ready, explore the land in search of adventure and fortune.

Answer the Queen’s call and fight together against the servants of the Black Moon. Defend the castle, banish the Beast, and save Avel!

In Chronicles of Avel players will be exploring the world of Avel, moving on a modular board created from hexagonal tiles (different every time). On their journey they will encounter dangerous monsters to fight and roll dice to determine success. Each victory leads to a prize - new weapon, armor, potions and gold - which will make heroes more powerful and unstoppable. But to earn equipment players will have to search through magical bag and choose using only their sense of touch. Victory awaits for those who will cooperate, prepare themselves and defeat the Beast and all his servants.

Title: Chronicles of Avel Publisher: Rebel Studio Language(s): English

boardgame.name: A Bestiary of Sundry Creatures
boardgame.description:
From publisher:

Bees emerge as blind worms from the flesh of rotting cows. The cockatrice is hatched from the eggs of black hens that have been corrupted by sorcerers. Kittens born in the month of May should be killed immediately since they will surely bring misfortune to the household. The caladarius bird dwells in the palaces of the great and by its gaze reveals whether an invalid will live or die. The Bestiary of Sundry Creatures sets out pre-modern people’s beliefs about many of the creatures that populated their world and their imagination. In addition to providing OSR (and Mork Borg) compatible statistics for these animals, it includes scholarly opinions and rustic folklore about the temperament, behaviour and medicinal and magical qualities of these creatures. GMs can use this material to make their medieval and early modern fantasy worlds richer, weirder and more immersive.

boardgame.name: The Green Hell of Inor
boardgame.description: “The Green Hell of Inor” is LFT’s attempt at bringing 2 weeks of epic fighting that took place in the Ardennes Forest during the very first days of Fall Gelb, the invasion of France, 1940.

listing.notes: New copy in shrink.

The Green Hell of Inor
Language: English Condition: New shrink-wrapped
SHIPPING COSTS send me message

boardgame.name: Dinner in Paris: Battle of the Chefs
boardgame.description:
On the Parisian square, competition among the restaurants still runs high and the animosity has escalated: theft of ingredients, noise pollution, terrace defacing… In this square in constant turmoil, you can count on your food truck to expand your influence and surprise your opponents.

FROM NOW ON, EVERYTHING IS PERMITTED IN ORDER TO BECOME THE BEST RESTAURANT OWNER IN PARIS

boardgame.name: Articles of the Arcana Tarot Deck
boardgame.description:
publisher blurb

"Tarot—much like Troika—is about interpretation, personal experience, and instinct."

A complete tarot deck is also available to use with Articles of the Arcana or as a standalone divination tool. It features UV treated and linen finished cards.

boardgame.name: Sanctum of the Ori Magi
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Sanctum of the Ori Magi is a short, origami-themed adventure for the Mausritter RPG. Players will explore the lair of a paper lich, discover paper treasures, and meet the lich's magical folded paper creations.

The party stumbles upon an origami crane with a simple plea written inside "Follow me! The Ori Magi need your help!"

The strange creature frantically flies off, leading them with urgency to a paper gateway in the wilderness. Through it, they find the Magi long gone; the sanctum is now home to Capriphel the paper lich and his machinations.

Can they find a way to escape, taking the lich's riches in the process? Can they unfold the secret to the lich's power and stop him for good? Or will they become part of his next ritual?

The adventure contains:

- A dungeon crawl through a paper lich's lair, full of strange creatures made of folded paper, a narrative to unwind, and puzzles to solve, all while the lich's ritual ticks towards completion
- A 7-entry bestiary full of origami creatures, featuring the paper-lich Capriphel
- 10 new treasures and magical artifacts to find
- A few hooks for placing the adventure into your existing world

boardgame.name: Drained Temple of the Brackish Basin
boardgame.description:
From the description:

When the saltwater pond known as the Brackish Basin is drained due to an upstream beaver dam, it leaves the citizens of Brineford without their livelihood. It also reveals an ancient temple on the pond floor, built by fish in generations past. What secrets could this long-submerged temple hold?

Drained Temple of the Brackish Basin is a pamphlet adventure for the Mausritter RPG that contains:

- A dungeon crawl through an aquatic themed temple
- 6 Items and a new spell to find
- A bestiary containing 5 entries
- 2 factions with opposed goals: the citizens of Brineford and the beavers

It can be run on it's own as a one-shot dungeon crawl, or inserted as a hex into an ongoing hexcrawl.

boardgame.name: Hunter: The Vigil (2nd Ed)
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

You've stumbled into shadows.
You know what lurks in darkness.
There are more monsters tonight than ever before.
It's time to fight back.

Hunter: The Vigil Second Edition includes:

Hunter presents a core set of rules and three options for gameplay for new or existing players. This game includes:


Overview of a hunter's world and lore, the types of hunters you can play, and three separate tiers of gameplay.



Six compacts and six conspiracies with Endowments for tiered play.



Character creation, rules to hunt, equipment, Tilts, and Conditions.



Monster creation and locations where to hunt the strange and unexplained.



The Slasher Chronicle, Storyteller advice, and more!

boardgame.name: The Thawing Kingdom
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Thawing Kingdom is a moody fantasy zine compatible with any and all rpg systems. It details the setting of a kingdom returning to life, after five-hundred years of being frozen by a dark spell. Inspirations from works like the Souls series and The Last Unicorn have been poured into this little pot to boil, to keep you warm in the waterlogged marshy wilderness of the Thawing Kingdom.

boardgame.name: Salvage
boardgame.description:
An oil tanker is on fire and you are a rescue team sent to deal with it. You will take damage as you put out the fires, but before the operation begins you can salvage oil as an insurance against the costs you expect to suffer.

Salvage is a simple trick-taking game that combines the fun of Hearts with the assessment of Oh Hell and the fairness of duplicate Bridge.

Everyone starts at 20 points and takes damage with every Salvage operation reducing their score. The game ends when one player reaches 0, at which point the player with the most points remaining wins.

The key dynamic of the game is that before playing a hand you assess the strength of your cards and make a bid of how many points you are prepared to lose not to play the hand. That bid acts as an insurance and you will only be penalised for points you lose above that bid. However if everyones combined bids equal the total amount of damage that can be taken, then everyone loses the amount they bid and the hands get passed around the table so that other players have a chance to do better with the same hand.

boardgame.name: Arkham Horror: Das Kartenspiel – Das Vermächtnis von Dunwich: Ermittler-Erweiterung
Arkham Horror: El Juego de Cartas – El Legado de Dunwich: Expansión de Investigadores
Arkham Horror: Il Gioco di Carte – L'Eredità di Dunwich: Espansione Investigatori
Arkham Horror: The Card Game – The Dunwich Legacy: Investigator Expansion
Horreur à Arkham: Le Jeu de Cartes – L'Héritage de Dunwich – Extension Investigateurs
Horror w Arkham: Gra Karciana – Dziedzictwo Dunwich: Rozszerzenie badaczy
boardgame.description:
A repackaging of the Dunwich Legacy cycle. All of the player cards for the cycle can be found in the Dunwich Legacy Investigator Expansion while all the encounter cards and campaign cards can be found in the Dunwich Legacy Campaign Expansion.
—user summary

The Dunwich Legacy is a deluxe expansion for Arkham Horror: The Card Game.

Several months ago, three Miskatonic University professors armed themselves with secret knowledge, traveled to Dunwich, and brought an end to the strange and terrifying creature that had been terrorizing the secluded village. Their heroic efforts brought peace to the region—for a while—but also left the men scarred by the horrors they had witnessed. Now, one of those professors, Dr. Armitage, has need of your assistance. His colleagues have gone missing, and he fears the worst…

The Dunwich Legacy challenges you to find the missing professors and launches you into a campaign that leads to Miskatonic University, the notorious Clover Club, and beyond. Five new investigators arrive to offer their services, armed with fifty-nine new player cards (including a complete playset of each) that allow you to pursue new deck-building strategies and new styles of play. Finally, you'll find all manner of new terrors arrayed against you—from backroom thugs and bad luck to arcane hexes and wholly unnatural abominations.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.description:
Designer blurb:

"In MUTANT MONSTER MACHINE GIRLS, you play as a member of "The Girls", a group of queer misfits fighting against an oppressive anarcho-capitalist state ruled by The Corporation.

Each of you fights against them because all your lives have been ruined by The Man Responsible, a dangerous and cruel servant of The Corporation. Because of his actions and the nature of your evolutions, you can no longer return to your previous lives and the people you love.

Your only solution? Exact your ultraviolent revenge on him and bring peace to the city by force!"

boardgame.name: RabbitZ & Robots
boardgame.description:
YEAR 30175: For thousands of years, the destruction of natural ecosystems and pollution have turned the planet into a desolate and practically uninhabitable place. While the less fortunate species have become extinct, others have adapted and evolved in union with the Orchard, the last green lung, our home. The RabbitZ!, a fearful horde of mutant zombie rabbits, come out of their burrow with only one goal... EAT! The Orchard and the vegetable people are in danger... But this time we are ready!

Using the technology of the Ancients, we have created great machines that are powered by the energy of the Orchard. Piloted by the brave Guardians of the Orchard, these powerful robots are our last hope.

Rabbitz & Robots is a tower defense card game for 1 to 5 players in which players will become the Guardians of the Orchard, a group of brave vegetables who pilot combat robots and defend the Orchard from the invasion of the RabbitZ.

Starting with the player who has the highest value RabbitZ in their path, the game will be played in turns and clockwise. Each player’s turn is divided into two phases:

In phase 1: Take the top card of the Burrow deck and place it at the start of your path (next to the Burrow deck) with the RabbitZ side up. If there are already other RabbitZ on your path, they will move in the direction of your Robot to make room for the new RabbitZ. The paths have a maximum of three spaces, this means that if there are already three RabbitZ in a path and a fourth one enters, it will push the others and the closest RabbitZ to the Robot will sneak into the player’s Garden, counting as a negative score at the end of the game.

In phase 2: Choose an action between: Super Attack, Charge Robot, Use weapons or Pass turn.

The game ends when the Burrow deck ends and there are no RabbitZs left in front of the players.

The player with the fewest negative points (RabbitZ value) in his Orchard wins.


AÑO 30175
Desde hace miles de años, la destrucción de ecosistemas naturales y la contaminación han convertido el planeta en un lugar desolado y prácticamente inhabitable.

Mientras que las especies menos afortunadas se han extinguido, otras nos adaptamos y evolucionamos en unión con la Huerta, el último pulmón verde, nuestro hogar.

Aquí, hortalizas de todos los colores convivimos y trabajamos unidas para proteger la tierra que nos da la vida. Pero se acerca la primavera y, como cada año, el miedo se apodera de la Huerta...

¡Los RabbitZ!, una temible horda de conejos zombis mutantes, salen de su madriguera con un único objetivo... ¡COMER!
La Huerta y el pueblo hortaliza están en peligro… ¡Pero esta vez estamos preparadas!

Utilizando la tecnología de los Antiguos hemos creado grandes máquinas que funcionan gracias a la energía de la Huerta, la fuerza mística de la naturaleza que fluye a través de la tierra y de cada hortaliza. Pilotados por los valientes Guardianes de la Huerta, estos poderosos robots son nuestra última esperanza.
-Anciano Coliflor

Rabbitz & Robots es un juego de cartas "tower defense" de 1 a 5 jugadores a partir de 10 años y con una duración aproximada de 20 minutos, en el que los jugadores se convertirán en los Guardianes de la Huerta, un grupo de valientes hortalizas que pilotan robots de combate y defienden la Huerta de la invasión de los RabbitZ.

OFFICIAL KICKSTARTER LINK TO FOLLOW THE LAUNCH: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/jocarandagames/ptolemae...

In Ptolemaeus, players are ambitious astronomers of Alexandria (Egypt) trying to prove they can predict the movement of the 7 known planets traveling through the 12 Zodiac constellations.

On their turn, players can take one of the following actions: draw 2 constellation cards, observe a constellations or observe a configuration of planets (conjunction, opposition, trine or square).

Observing constellations or configurations allows players to place their Almagest tokens on the game board, which are then used to study planets to obtain victory points.

Only the sharpest observer of the firmament will be known as Ptolemy’s first disciple and help in the writing of the Almagest.

RULEBOOKS:
Rulebooks of Ptolemaeus are now available in the "file" section, in the following languages: English, Italian, German, French and Spanish.

boardgame.name: Springtime for Hitler
boardgame.description:
Shortly after Poland was conquered in 1939, Hitler begin urging an immediate attack in the West. The original plans were uninspiring and his generals feared an attritional stalemate. Over the winter the Germans keep taking the measure of their opponents and hit upon a plan was that inspired, risky, and utterly decisive. Ironic of Hitler to assume his remarkable success was simply the new template for all future campaigns. His eyes turned east....

But, why, exactly did France fall? Against the Odds' 2015 annual features four top designers all tasked with re-examining the 1940 campaign and answering that very question. They’ve each settled on a single overriding theme to focus on.

Springtime for Hitler explores the angle that the Germans at this time were quite simply indeed "supermen" at the top of their game. Possessing the best tactical air force, the best plans and doctrine, and well motivated by National-Socialist ideology, they were unstoppable. Or were they?

boardgame.name: Arracourt
boardgame.description:
Arracourt is a Battalion Combat Series (BCS) game depicting the forlorn Axis counterattack to stop Patton’s drive across France in September 1944 and the stellar example of mobile US Combined Arms that stopped that offensive dead in its tracks.

The rapid movement of Patton’s Third Army eastward to Nancy has led them at the end of a supply net that is being re-allocated to put emphasis on the British in the north (which resulted in Operation Market Garden). The US 4th Armored Division in the lead performed a double envelopment of Nancy and is waiting for other elements to catch up.

For the German part, Hitler sees an opportunity to do two things simultaneously: To strike at the US spearhead stopping their advance and to try out his newly formed Panzer Brigades—complete with Panthers just off the assembly line but manned by crews fresh out of training.

The result was a classic defense studied by the US Army still today as the “school solution” of how to defeat an armored foe in a mobile set of battles.

Arracourt is a game of those battles with both sides using all the tools of mobile warfare with both sides maneuvering to attack and defend the ground of their choosing. The game is straightforward for the beginner BCS player and works very well as a starter kit before trying any of the others in the series yet is still challenging for the BCS veteran. All scenarios are on one (or less than one) map.

There are very few special rules to employ, well, except for dealing with Bazooka Charlie … a US L-4 artillery observation pilot who rigged his wings with bazooka launchers so he could go out daily and try to kill German tanks.

Scenarios:

Arracourt Campaign (13 turns)
Saga of the Panzer Brigades (5 turns)
Battle of Lunéville (Small) (2 turns)
Patton’s Vanguard (12 turns)
Battle of Arracourt (Small) (4 turns)
Ghost Division (Small) (4 turns)



Components:

BCS rulebook (v2.0, in full color)
Two BCS Charts and Tables (v2.0, in full color)
BCS Support rulebook (v2.0, in full color)
Arracourt game specific rulebook
Turn Record Track card
One 22” x 34” full color game map
352 5/8” Counters (one unit sheet and one marker sheet)
Six scenarios, all one-map or less, and four are five turns or less
Box and dice


(from MMP website)

boardgame.name: The Seeds of Disaster
boardgame.description:
Shortly after Poland was conquered in 1939, Hitler begin urging an immediate attack in the West. The original plans were uninspiring and his generals feared an attritional stalemate. Over the winter the Germans keep taking the measure of their opponents and hit upon a plan was that inspired, risky, and utterly decisive. Ironic of Hitler to assume his remarkable success was simply the new template for all future campaigns. His eyes turned east.

But why, exactly, did France fall? Against the Odds 2017 Annual features four top designers all tasked with re-examining the 1940 campaign and answering that very question.

The Seeds of Disaster is a game about how events of the 1930s affected World War II, most especially the German invasion
of the West in 1940. This game connects a war campaign with the military preparations, intelligence developments, and diplomacy that preceded it. It is an attempt to represent a piece of history as interconnected with other historical developments. This is a two-player game in which one player takes the Germans and the other the Western Allies, including
France, Great Britain, Belgium, and Holland. Victory is determined by control of Mobilization Center and Objective Areas at the end of the last turn of play.

In broad outline, what you see here is a game that is multi-dimensional and coupled. The initial phase of play creates a game history of the 1930s to generate the concrete situation for the German invasion of the West in 1940. By intertwining fresh dimensions of Intelligence and Command, the game creates new ways in which the 1940 situation can be distinctive from
one play of the game to the next. The invasion campaign is the culmination of the game. With this partially scripted history,
how does the war progress? The geography will be the same, the deployment of the forces may be similar, but the details of
the forces and their Intelligence and Command postures can be very different.

boardgame.name: Betrayal!
boardgame.description:
Shortly after Poland was conquered in 1939, Hitler begin urging an immediate attack in the West. The original plans were uninspiring and his generals feared an attritional stalemate. Over the winter the Germans keep taking the measure of their opponents and hit upon a plan was that inspired, risky, and utterly decisive. Ironic of Hitler to assume his remarkable success was simply the new template for all future campaigns. His eyes turned east.

But why, exactly, did France fall? Against the Odds 2017 Annual features four top designers all tasked with re-examining the 1940 campaign and answering that very question.

'Betrayal!' is a strategic level game of the German invasion of France, Belgium, and the Netherlands in May 1940. After
finishing campaigns in Poland, Denmark, and Norway, Hitler turned to France. The goal was to knock France down and
then prepare for the subjugation of Britain and the invasion of the Soviet Union.

Pre-war planning, coupled with valuable experience gained in Poland, would lead the Wehrmacht to excel in lightning
warfare never before seen on such a massive scale. While the French had re-visited World War One with a static Maginot
Line defending their border, the Germans went beyond this and brought in blitzkrieg. There were a few bumps along the
way. The smaller British army and those from tiny Belgium and Netherlands tried to help France.

The game has two Allied players, one French and one British. They will alternate, depending on initiative, in handling
the automata German side. Internal differences between the allies can arise according to their separate and unique victory conditions.

boardgame.name: Data Leak
boardgame.description:
Data Leak is a game of making words and breaking passwords. Acting as a skilled computer hacker, you will attempt to break your opponents’ passwords before they can break yours, knowing that these passwords must be formed from a pool of only 45 letters.
Unfortunately, data leaks happen every turn and you’ll have to be canny about which letters of your password you reveal to your opponents.
By browsing the darknet and using threats such as viruses, worms and trojan horses, more letters will be revealed until you eventually break your opponents’ passwords.
The last player with an unguessed password will win the game.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Desde el Banco: Fútbol de Tablero

Desde el Banco ("From the Bench"), Tabletop Soccer, is a sports strategy game for two players, where each one is the Coach of a fantasy soccer team. Select the team, build your squad, raise your formation and take them to the field.

A board game that undoubtedly awakens the passions and mischief of soccer, accompanied by the chance of the dice. The components are soccer player and team cards, big-headed soccer player miniatures, ball miniature, interlocking colored rings to identify the teams, energy tokens, dice and a flexible fabric printed board, all in a very colorful and eye-catching box.

During the match, the Coach must put together their best strategy, use the special skills of the players, and the special abilities of the team players to score the goal.

Each Coach take the victory by scoring the most goals.

boardgame.name: La Cité des ombres
boardgame.description:
The City of Shadows board game is a co-creation of the Les Baroudeurs brand and Agent Paper.

Discover a strategic board game full of twists and turns playable in 2 teams of 2, 4, or 6 players. Your goal is simple: take control of Rennes (the city, not those of Santa Claus).

For this, several means are available to you:
- Capture all the properties of the game board
- Kill all the characters of the opposing team
- Arrest the entire opposing clan by the police
- Discreetly poison the drinks of opposing players (this victory mode can only work once against the same players)

Explore the city of Rennes and its iconic late 18th-century locations while using strategy, cunning, and composure to win the game.


Le jeu de plateau Cité des Ombres est une co-création de la marque Les Baroudeurs et d’Agent Paper.
Découvrez un jeu de plateau stratégique plein de rebondissements jouable en 2 équipes de 2, 4, ou 6 joueurs. Votre but est simple : prenez le contrôle de Rennes (la ville, pas ceux du Père Noël). Pour cela, plusieurs moyens sont mis à votre disposition :
– Capturez toutes les propriétés du plateau de jeu
– Tuez tous les personnages de l’équipe adverse
– Faites arrêtez par la police tout le clan adverse
– Empoisonnez discrètement les boissons des joueurs adverses (ce mode de victoire ne peut fonctionner qu’une fois contre les mêmes joueurs)Explorez la ville de Rennes et ses lieux emblématiques de la fin du XVIIIe siècle tout en faisant preuve de stratégie, de ruse et de sang froid afin de gagner la partie.

boardgame.name: The Gates of Medina (fan expansion for Medina)
boardgame.description:
Unofficial variant, tested and approved by the author

The gates allow you to leave the city.
Each side of the city must have an opening which is indicated either by the free space separating the walls originating from either corner tower, or by a gate placed by a player which indicates the limit for placing walls.
During their turn, a player can choose to place a gate as one of their actions, respecting the following conditions:

The gate must be placed adjacent to a wall; it cannot be placed directly adjacent to a tower.
The gate must either be placed next to an empty space on the board, or next to one occupied by a merchant.
Only one gate can be placed on each side of the city.


Consequences of placing a gate

The gate stops the construction of the wall against which it is placed, so the wall originating from the same corner tower can’t be extended beyond the gate.
The wall coming from the opposite corner tower on the same side of the city can continue to be lengthened until it eventually reaches the gate.
A building or a stable can’t be built against a gate. However, a merchant can be placed next to a gate.


Complete rules in english and french are in the links

boardgame.name: Golden Top Game
boardgame.description:
The game combines questions with bets. On a circuit, the players move their game pieces by rolling the dice. Bets can be placed on the dice roll of a fellow player or on the correct answer to a question card. A fast rounding of the playing field brings additional money. The player who has collected the most money after an agreed time wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Pool Towels
Sunbed Rush
boardgame.description:
Sunbed Rush is a strategic card game.

While reserving sunbeds in real life is not very kind to your fellow guests at a resort, it is absolutely mandatory in Sunbed Rush! Place your towels to reserve your sunbed. Secure your sunbed with an object to make it look like you really are in the neighborhood. Or place a guest on your sunbed; a guest who will help you with his or her quirks. Make sure to secure the best and the most sunbeds to earn points and win the game!

The game is played in 8 rounds. Each round players receive 1 new card from the draw pile after which they all choose 2 cards to play in that game round.
A player can select 2 cards in any combination of:
- towel cards (to reserve a spot at any pool)
- object cards (towels with an object on it cannot be removed)
- guest cards (placed on your towel to help you)
- activity cards (to clear the entire pool of the guests indicated on the activity card)

After 8 rounds, players no longer have cards in their hands and the game ends.

The player with the most points wins, points are counted at the end of the game where you earn points for:
1. Having the most towels at a pool: Each pool card indicates the number of points players can earn for having the most towels at that pool
2. Empty/unoccupied towel: each unoccupied towel (a towel without a guest or object) earns 1 additional point

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Klattschen: White Edition
boardgame.description: The official Expansion includes 60 new Cards with 45 new orders.

boardgame.name: Fenix (No. 2, 2021 - English only)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fenix #2, 2021 is all about MISHAPS and UNINTENDED CONSEQUENCES, which Graeme Davis and Pete Nash have interpreted in different ways. Graeme Davis went back to a lot of his previous articles for Fenix and added a lot of new and fun game play to each and every one of those mentioned here. It adds twists and fun and ever more interesting gaming sessions ahead. Pete Nash took another route, diving straight into the humorous spells of faeries from Lyonesse, creating even more tongue in cheeks mishaps and interesting situations for players who encounter them. Both are gems worth exploring.

Tales of the Unexpected – 5 pages of Graeme Davis’ gems
Unintended consequences are part of what makes a roleplaying session fun and interesting, from a rescue mission that turns out to be a kidnapping to an imaginative player finding a way to turn a 1st level spell into an unstoppable murder weapon. In the few years that I have been writing for Fenix, I’ve made more than a few suggestions that can have unintended consequences. Perhaps one consequence of reading this article will be that you are inspired to dig out your back issues and look at them with fresh eyes! All of them are available on Drivethrurpg – in the issue of Fenix where they were first published (mentioned in the article, if you would like to explore any of them further).

Mishaps – 5 pages humorous hodgepodge of fairy spells from Lyonesse by Pete Nash
This issue marks my 50th article for Fenix Magazine, all but one of which have been published since the start of 2013. Not too shabby, if I say so myself. Thus to celebrate this modest accomplishment, I shall use this issue’s theme to shamelessly plug one of the most recent Mythras publications, the monstrously comprehensive and well received Lyonesse. A campaign setting representing the world and characters as described in Suldrun’s Garden, The Green Pearl, and Madouc.

boardgame.name: Parallel Worlds (Issue 25 - Sep 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this issue:

Age of Sigmar, Alyx: An AI’s Guide to Love and Murder, Black Void, Chivalry & Sorcery, Dark Alliance, Fading Suns, Ginny Di, Loki, Marvel Cinematic Universe, Rangers of Shadow Deep, the Harm Tree, Wildermyth’s Nate Austin
boardgame.rpg: Rangers of Shadow Deep: A Tabletop Adventure Game

boardgame.name: Dungeon Beasts 5E Bonus Material
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This free PDF contains stats for the Frost Worm and the Krenshar for 5th Edition, along with extraplanar, undead and other versions of both creatures.

boardgame.name: The Grassy Sea
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Grassy Sea is a a blackpowder expansion & hex crawl for sword-and-whiskers role-playing.

The Grassy Sea swells with wind,

waxing and waning

with the seasons.

But in summertime

when the grass

grows green and long,

pirates lurk in the fields,

ready to plunder.

The Grassy Sea includes a 19-point hex map and full adventure site for The Hollow Tree Gang, as well as the blackpowder rules, weapons, and items. An 8 page supplement ready for your mice to explore.

boardgame.name: Zoomer
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this File, zoomers! A brand new archetype that any character can take that’ll allow you to ask, “Do YOU have the need for speed?” This archetype includes six pages of feats, including a dedication that allows you to choose the source of your super speed, a list of additional feats, focus spells, and more!

boardgame.name: Hadrian's Marble
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

One of our high level offerings, the show didn't go the way it was planned so there are a lot of surprised in this offering. Your quartet is headed to an dormant volcano to locate an artifact known as Hadrian's Marble!

This offering was a fantastic time for the Murder Hobo Inc. podcast show on Twitch. This scenario was designed for four, ninth level PCs.
